s;Aqua;It has been a wonderful experience so far.|Thank you very much for your hospitality, Your Highness.
s;Semi;Yeah, it's been okay, I guess.
s;Krista;Glad to hear it!|{c:e;Krista;NoSmile}Anyway, about investigating Archbishop Azalea and all that,|you guys got any ideas?
s;Semi;From what I've heard,|Foliaga's smaller villages have been primary targets of the disappearances.|The village of Windbrook near the border would be a good place to start.

s;Krista;We'll head out to Windbrook tomorrow, then!|I'll get a strategy meeting going to decide what to do from there.|{c:e;Krista;NoSmile}You guys rest easy 'til then.|I can only imagine how rough the past few days have been.
s;Krista;Felicity! How's my favorite maid doing?
s;Felicity;Horribly!|{c:e;Felicity;NormalBlink}You were gone for longer than expected.|I thought I would never see you again!
s;Krista;Aw, Felicity{tgm}...{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}{tgm} Forrest managed to get me back like he always does.|{c:e;Krista;Smile}No need to worry as long as he's around!
s;Felicity;I suppose so{tgm}...|{c:e;Felicity;NormalBlink}{tgm}Still, you shouldn't put yourself in so much danger.|Everyone was worried about you!
s;Krista;Sorry, sorry.|{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes}But uh. How do I put this{tgm}...|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}{tgm}I'm gonna be putting myself in danger again? Possibly?
s;Felicity;No!! If that's the case, let me come with you!

s;Krista;No can do. Sounds like some serious stuff is going down in Foliaga.|If something happens to you, I dunno what I'd do.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}Speaking of which, I'm gonna round everyone up for a strategy meeting.|Mind making sure the war room is prepped for that?
s;Krista;And no eavesdropping during the meeting.
s;Felicity;Hm~? Now, why would I do that?
s;Krista;Because it's what you always do.
s;Krista;I'll believe it when I see it.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}Anyway, I gotta gather people up.{br}See ya!
s;Felicity;"No eavesdropping", hm?|{c:e;Felicity;NormalBlink,Smile}I'll just "happen" to be sweeping up just outside the war room, then. Heehee~
s;Krista;Alright, as per Semi's suggestion, we'll be starting our investigation in Windbrook.|But what do we do from there?

s;Kai;If the investigation warrants us to actually confront the Archbishop herself--|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}Which it most likely will--|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}We will take the fastest route to the capital city of Oakenfaire.|We'll head directly eastward towards{br}Lake Lunaris.|There is a village there that we can stop at to restock on supplies.|The rest of the path to Oakenfaire is filled with forests,|so it may be a bit until we see civilization.
s;Forrest;This is what you consider the fastest?

s;Aqua;Outsiders aren't supposed to know about this,|but Foliaga's major monasteries have secret underground passages|that lead directly to Oakenfaire.|It makes it easier for members of the church to travel throughout the country.

s;Kai;Ha! Am I glad we managed to rescue you, Aqua. This changes everything!|{c:e;Kai;NoSmile}So, we'll still head to Lake Lunaris for supplies, as I've stated before.|Then we'll head to the closest major city: Mossgrove.|Once we're there, we'll make our way into its monastery's secret passageway.|Aqua, think you can get us in somehow?
s;Aqua;As a member of the church, I'm sure I can manage something.
s;Kai;Perfect. Sound like a plan, everyone?
s;Krista;I'm down!|Steel yourselves, guys. We've got a big day tomorrow!
s;Felicity;Hmm, so that's what's going on{tgm}...
s;Viola;Felicity? What are you up to?
s;Felicity;What the--?!|Oh, Viola, it's just you.
s;Felicity;Done training with the other pegasus knights today?
s;Viola;Yup! I was going to the dining hall to grab a bite to eat.|Wanna join me?
s;Viola;What is it?|Looks like you're thinking real hard about something.
s;Felicity;Hey, want to do something fun?
s;Viola;You bet I do! What is it?
s;Felicity;You see, Her Highness is going off an adventure tomorrow, and I was wondering{tgm}...
s;Forrest;It's quite a small village.|Who knows if we'll actually find any information here.
s;Man2;Greetings, travellers!{br}Welcome to Windbrook.|I'm the mayor of this village. Is there something I can assist you with?
s;Forrest;Actually, yes.|We've heard that many of Foliaga's citizens have been going missing.|Has anything of the sort happened here?
s;Man2;Fortunately, everyone in Windbrook is accounted for.|We all pray for our fellow Folians' safety in these trying times.|But why do you ask?
s;Krista;We're looking into this situation ourselves.|If you know anything at all, we'd love to hear it.
s;Man2;Now that you mention it, there have been rather concerning claims about{tgm}...|{c:e;Man2;CloseEyes}{tgm}No, perhaps I shouldn't say.
s;Forrest;Please, sir. Go on.{br}This may be important.
s;Man2;I'm sorry, but I can't risk word somehow getting to the Archbishop.|Forget I said anything. Goodbye.
s;Semi;This is exactly what I was afraid of.|Everyone's quaking in their boots trying to not get on the Archbishop's bad side.
s;Kai;Someone's gotta be willing to say something.|Let's keep asking around town and see what we can find.
s;SoldierGreen;Hey, you're that new guy.{br}Michael, right?
s;SoldierGreen;Try not to look so nervous. It's a big mission, I know.
s;SoldierGreen;Look, you just gotta remember that you're fighting for the good of Foliaga.|That's why you joined the Knights in the first place, right?
s;SoldierGreen;That's the spirit! Now, get ready to move.

s;Michael;Maybe this is just the nerves talking, but is this really right?|We're in Windbrook. Nothing happens in a small village like this.|Did we even need this many of the Knights for this mission?;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Irving;Attention, Windbrook!|By order of Archbishop Azalea, you are all under arrest.|Come quietly, and no harm will come to you.
s;Man2;The Holy Knights? Here? Could it be{tgm}...?
s;Man2;Everyone, get inside! Lock your doors!
s;Aqua;They're Foliaga's Holy Knights. They work directly under the Archbishop.
s;Semi;There were rumors that the Knights were responsible for the disappearances.|{c:e;Semi;HalfCloseEyes}Looks like they were true.
s;Krista;No wonder the mayor was too scared to say anything.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}Either way, we can't let the Knights harm the villagers.
s;Krista;Everyone, check up on each house and make sure they're secured!
s;Krista;We have to protect as many of the villagers as we can!
s;Michael;This isn't right. They can't all be criminals or heretics.|Something's wrong here.|Windbrook{tgm}...{tgm} I need to protect it!

s;Michael;If I stay right here, then at least everyone in this house will be safe.|But what about everyone else?|{c:e;Michael;CloseEyes}Oh no, oh no{tgm}...{tgm} I should have never joined the Knights.
prep;false;Prepare to Charge;<green>Guide</>;True;AccessLibrary;Access the guide for tips and tricks.;gba;no_chap_disp

name: ReinforceTurn5-9
_source: s;;A new Guide entry has been added.{br}<red>(Thieves)</>;StyleNid=hint;NumLines=3;no_sound

name: BaseConvo_Sneaking In
_source: s;Aqua;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} Mossgrove's monestary should be in this direction.
s;SoldierGreenFemale;Hey, isn't she that cleric from Vergrande Monestary?|The one travelling with the Medean princess?
s;SoldierGreen;Yeah, you're right! You're coming with us.
s;Aqua;Please just let me go. I{tgm}...!
s;SoldierGreen;Relax, we're not gonna do anything to you or your friends.|We just needed to take this somewhere private.
s;SoldierGreenFemale;You're trying to do something about Archbishop Azalea, right?|We can't do much to help you directly,|but we know a safer way to get to her than what you guys might have planned.
s;SoldierGreen;We would've taken you to the dungeons right away and left you to the higher-ups|if we weren't on your side.
s;Aqua;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Okay. You have a point.|Semi? Are you nearby? You may want to be here to hear them out too.
s;Semi;You better not backstab us, you hear me?
s;SoldierGreen;I swear by the Great Folia that we'll be aiding you to the best of our ability.
s;Semi;What do you guys have in mind, then?
s;SoldierGreenFemale;I'm assuming your plan was to use the tunnel hidden at the temple?
s;SoldierGreenFemale;Scrap that plan. There's a full squadron waiting down there.|Hundreds of men are squatting in the main tunnels waiting for you all to show up.

s;SoldierGreen;We recommend using this tunnel here.|There are still some Knights on watch there, but not as many as in the main tunnels.|This one bypasses Mossgrove Temple's main tunnel and connects to the main network.|From there, it should be a relatively easier path to Oakenfaire Monestary.
s;SoldierGreenFemale;You would have to pass through the monestary's courtyard,|then you'll be at the Grand Temple of Folia.|That's where the Archbishop resides.
s;Aqua;That seems to be our best option. What do you think, Semi?
s;Semi;Assuming these guys are telling the truth, we should follow through on this.|I'm gonna report back to the princess about the change of plans.
s;SoldierGreen;Before you go, do you mind if we assist you in navigating the tunnels?|I believe it would help build your trust in us in this endevour.
s;Semi;Sure, do what you want.|But the moment you guys rat us out, you're done for.
alert;The two Holy Knights will help for the chapter!

name: BaseConvo_Team Dad
_source: s;Forrest;Now would be a good time to check on our supplies.|Is there anything we have that is in need of immediate attention?
s;Kai;Other than some weapon repairs, I think we're good.
s;Krista;We should probably stock up on more rations, though.|Our army's just getting bigger, so we'll need to compensate for that.
s;Trevor;If that is the case,|more tents and spare changes of clothing may be necessary as well.
s;Forrest;Good point. Speaking of which, all of you are in good health, I assume?|Not skipping meals? No illnesses to speak of?
s;Kai;Heh, what are you, our dad?
s;Trevor;Now that you mention it, Forrest does seem very fatherly.

name: SupportTrevorAnil
_source: s;Trevor;Anil, my friend!|Could you spare me a moment of your time?
s;Trevor;I shall take that as a "yes"!
s;Trevor;You see,|Her Highness assigned me to inform everyone of their duties in the upcoming days,|and I would like to inform you--
s;Anil;*takes out a sheet of parchment and writes on it*;no_talk
s;Trevor;Hm? What did you write?|Let me take a look{tgm}...|{c:e;Trevor;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}"You talk too much. Goodbye."?
s;Trevor;You were assigned to do kitchen duty this week!|Come back!!
s;Trevor;Anil, my friend, I have something I wish to ask of you.
s;Trevor;I promise I will be quick about it.
s;Trevor;Please hear me out, I beg of you!|If you do not wish to fulfill my request,|I promise you will not have to speak to me ever again.
s;Anil;*points to mouth and shakes head*;no_talk
s;Trevor;Yes, yes, I know you cannot speak! Please take this seriously!|As I alluded to before, this is my request.|Could you please teach me sign language?
s;Trevor;I assume you are wondering why I would ask this of you?

s;Trevor;Well, the other day, you informed me that I spoke too much.|So, I thought that if I learned how to sign,|you would not have to hear me speak as often as before.|Does this sound satisfactory to you?
s;Trevor;Excellent! Thank you so much, Anil.|I promise I will listen to your teachings to the best of my ability!
s;Anil;[Good try. It's more like:]|["My friend, Anil. How are you today?"]
s;Trevor;I see! Hold on, let me try again.|{tgm}{c:e;Trevor;NoSmile}[My friend... Anil. How... are you... today??]
s;Anil;*nods*|[Good job. You're a quick learner, Trevor.]
s;Anil;[Haha, almost got it. But I still understood what you meant.]|[Oh, I've got a fun one to teach you. Look.]|[@%!*]
s;Anil;[It's another way you can say "fu--]
s;Trevor;I will choose to not use that, thank you very much!!
s;Anil;[Why not? It can be useful sometimes.]
s;Trevor;I fail to see how that can be useful in any situation.
s;Anil;[Okay, okay. Here, I'll teach you an actual useful one. Watch.]|["I love you."]
s;Trevor;Anil, I swear if you're tricking me--
s;Trevor;Hmmm. I assume that meant "I love you"?
s;Trevor;Allow me to try.|{tgm}[I... love... you.]
s;Anil;[Good job. Go ahead and try again.]
s;Anil;[Sorry, Trevor. You're just easy to tease.]
s;Trevor;*sigh* Still, I appreciate you doing this for me, Anil.|These lessons have been of the utmost help.
s;Anil;[Good. I'm glad I could help.]
s;Trevor;I have an urgent matter I wish to discuss with you.
s;Anil;[Am I on kitchen duty again?]
s;Trevor;I--Well, yes, you are, actually.|But that is not the point!|There are more urgent matters at hand.
s;Trevor;Anil, please take this seriously.|I am trying to tell you something important.
s;Anil;[Sorry, just poking fun at you.]|{c:e;Anil;NoSmile}[Go ahead, Trevor. I'm listening.]
s;Trevor;You see, I have perused the castle library some time ago|and taught myself more sign language on my own.
s;Anil;[Oh, really? Let me see how much you've learned, then.]

s;Trevor;I apologize if I get something wrong, but here we go.|{tgm}[Anil, I... believe you are...]|[smart... and patient... and a good... friend.]|[I admire you... a lot. And that... is why I... will give you this.]
s;Trevor;*nods*|[I want to... spend the rest... of my life... with you.]|[Will you... take my hand... in marriage?];no_talk
s;Anil;*nod* *nod* *nod*|[I love you. I love you. I love you!]
s;Trevor;[I love you too, Anil. I love you too so so much.];no_talk

name: BaseConvo_Customer Service
_source: s;Jake;Let's see here{tgm}...{tgm} Swords will go in this compartment, and the lances will go there{tgm}...
s;Jake;Oh, you startled me! You're Anil, right? Needed something?
s;Anil;*gestures to his bow and takes out a sack of coins*
s;Jake;A new bow for ya? Sure! No need to pay me, though.|We're on the same team, so it's on the house.
s;Jake;I understand sign language, just so you know.|I taught it to myself so I could better communicate with people on the job.
s;Anil;[Really? Did you have to speak with people like me often?]
s;Jake;Often enough. Being a traveling merchant means you gotta deal with all kinds of people.
s;Anil;[There aren't many people out there like you with that kind of consideration.]
s;Anil;[Most of the time, Ecco has to do the talking for the both of us.]
s;Anil;[Most of the time, my friend Ecco had to do the talking for the both of us.]
s;Jake;Well, that's a darn shame.|The way I see it, a customer's satisfaction is a merchant's number one priority!|{c:e;Jake;Smile}And that all starts with proper communication.
s;Anil;[You're a good man, Jake.]|[Just make sure no one takes advantage of your kind attitude.]
s;Jake;Aw, shucks. You're making me blush.|No need to worry about me, though.|When the time's right, me and Anna will go back to Oregot and make things better--
s;Jake;I mean! Uh! Forget I said anything!|A-Anyway, here's that bow. Bye, Anil!!

name: SupportAlexLucy
_source: s;Lucy;Wow, it smells really good here.|{c:e;Lucy;Smile}Oh, Miss Alex! What are you up to?
s;Alex;Hello, Lucy. Just brewing some tea.|Would you like some?
s;Alex;Here you go.|Be careful. It's hot.
s;Lucy;This is really good! What kind of tea is it?
s;Alex;It's a blend of chamomile and lavender.|I've read that both are good for sleep and relaxation.
s;Lucy;That's amazing! Tea can do that?
s;Alex;Yes, to some extent.|It can't replace eating well and taking care of your body, but it can help.|If you'd like, I could lend you my book on different teas.|You seem quite interested.
s;Lucy;That would be great! Thank you very much, Miss Alex!
s;Alex;Of course.|If you happen to come across a tea that you might like, let me know.|I'll see if I can brew it for you.
s;Lucy;Miss Alex! I found a tea I want to try.
s;Alex;That one is quite good. It's one of my favorites.|{c:e;Alex;NoSmile}What caught your interest with this one in particular?
s;Lucy;That book you lent me said that it's good for soothing a sore throat.|I was hoping it could ease my mother's symptoms, at least.
s;Alex;Ah, I see. How about we make a batch together?|That way we can figure out a good way to prepare it|before having your mother give it a try.
s;Alex;Alright, looks like it's done. Let me pour you a cup, Lucy.|{c:e;Alex;Smile}Feel free to add some lemon and honey, but don't go overboard.
s;Lucy;Thank you very much, Miss Alex. I think I'll try it as is first.
s;Lucy;Oh, wow, I can see why this is recommended for sore throats.|You can really feel it go down with just a little sip.
s;Alex;Yes, I agree.|That's why I prefer to have it with a squeeze of lemon and some honey.|Not only do their flavors compliment the ginger, they can also ease an ailing throat.
s;Lucy;Ahh{tgm}...|{c:e;Lucy;NormalBlink,Smile}{tgm}That's really good! I think I know how to prepare this for my mother now.|Thank you very much, Miss Alex!
s;Alex;You're very welcome, Lucy. Please let me know what she thinks of the tea.
s;Lucy;Miss Alex! Thanks again for helping with the tea.|Mom really liked it.
s;Alex;I'm glad to hear that, Lucy.
s;Lucy;I just wish there was more I could do for her.
s;Alex;Well, there's only so much you can do.|{c:e;Alex;Smile}But I think what you have done has been helping a lot.
s;Alex;Absolutely.|If anything, I'm sure your mother is happy that her daughter cares so much for her.
s;Lucy;Thank you, Miss Alex, but I still want to try harder for her.

s;Alex;Hm{tgm}...|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink}{tgm}I have an idea. Why don't I teach you how to grow your own ginger?|I've been reading up on how to grow various herbs and roots for tea.|Ginger does take a while to grow, but if we start now,|we'll be able to harvest it sometime next year.
s;Alex;Then, let's grab some ginger roots from the market.|We can plant them in the fields behind the castle when we come back.
s;Alex;Alright, this looks good.|We just have to let the maids know to take care of these while we're away.
s;Lucy;Oh, I should go to the infirmary and check up on Mom.|{c:e;Lucy;Smile}Thank you again, Miss Alex. This was really fun!
s;Alex;Of course. See you later, Lucy.

name: SupportAlexMarina
_source: s;Marina;Oh, hello, Alex. A reader yourself, I see.|Mind if I join you?
s;Alex;Not at all. Actually, I do need someone to converse with.|Please take a seat and let me pour you a cup of tea.
s;Marina;Now, what is on your mind?
s;Alex;Someday I would like to find my own white knight who could protect my honor.
s;Marina;There is something appealing about a dashing champion, isn't there?|However, I'm afraid that while there are good men in the world,|there isn't a Mister Perfect.
s;Alex;Oh, I know that.{br}Everyone's human.|That's not quite the dilemma.
s;Marina;What is it then, dear? You look like something is troubling you.
s;Alex;It's{tgm}...{tgm} It's me.|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink}I worry that an eligible and reputable man would find me lacking.|You, though, probably have many suitors.
s;Marina;While it is true that there are many who like the idea of being with me,|it isn't Marina they want to be with.|{c:e;Marina;NoSmile,NormalBlink}It's MARINA they want.
s;Marina;They don't want me, Alex.|They want the woman they see on the posters. The woman they see on the stage.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes}They want THAT Marina.
s;Alex;I'm sorry. I didn't mean to complain.
s;Marina;I know, dear. I wasn't suggesting you were.|I only meant that you don't have to worry about people|falling over each other for an IDEA of you.|They will want you for you.
s;Marina;You may not have what some call "the perfect body", but you have your own appeal.|There's something to be said about a moderate woman.

s;Alex;I never considered that.|{c:e;Alex;CloseEyes}Still, I wonder if I would even catch someone's eye.|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink}While I'm not looking for a Prince Charming,|I'm looking for someone I can fall in love with.|Someone to marry and look after. And he would look after me in return.

s;Marina;Alex. You have more going for you than you realize.|While you are mature enough to understand there is no Prince Charming,|you shouldn't worry about being the perfect girl either.|There are still men who don't care about perfect. They just want a loving wife.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes}Unfortunately for me, being a dancer makes finding such a man difficult.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}But they do exist.
s;Marina;No, thank YOU, Alex.|It was a lovely talk, and thank you for the tea.|If you feel the need to talk about any other concerns,|please don't hesitate to come to me.
s;Alex;Marina, may I ask you something?
s;Marina;Of course, dear. What seems to be the trouble?
s;Alex;I was thinking about our conversation the other day.|What is it like being a dancer?|It seems like you enjoy the stage, but the experience isn't without hardship.

s;Marina;An accurate observation, Alex.{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile} Dancing is my strongest passion.|Expressing myself through my movements and losing myself to the beat is exhilarating.|However, with my skill came the jealousy of other dancers|and the attention of some rather uncouth suitors.
s;Alex;I shudder to think what "uncouth" precisely means in this context.

s;Marina;Men who only wished to see their base desires met, Alex.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes}Money, fame, carnal fascination{tgm}...|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}{tgm}Though, I can't blame them for wanting such things from me.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}It's understandable when you have a certain beauty and talent about you.
s;Alex;You almost sound proud of the unwanted attention.

s;Marina;When I was younger, I most definitely was. A crowd is a crowd no matter who was in it.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,NoSmile}Though, I came to realize that such things are temporary.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink}The body ages and you're not quite as spry and alluring as you used to be.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}No one wants to see an old hag shake her stuff.

s;Alex;Please, Marina. You're not that old.|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink,Smile}I'd say you still have a charm to your appearance,|and your dances are a marvel to witness.|I can only imagine how even more beautiful you and your dances were years ago.
s;Marina;Oh, Alex, you flatter me so.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}Keep talking like that, and I'm sure you can string along any man you desire.
s;Alex;Ah, well, I'm only saying what I think.
s;Marina;And I'm saying your honesty is an admirable trait.|Don't be afraid to share your opinions, dear.|There are men out there who appreciate an intellectual woman like yourself.

s;Marina;Oh, no need to be so embarrassed.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}Like I said before, you'll find someone who will love you for who you are.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Why, I'd go so far as to say you've charmed me by just being yourself.
s;Marina;Just teasing you, dear.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}But in all honesty, spending time with you does make me feel young again.
s;Alex;I'm glad to hear that. I enjoy spending time with you too.

name: SupportEccoAnil
_source: s;Ecco;Alright, I've gone through the numbers.|With Her Highness oh, so kindly providing rations, weapons, and all other essentials,|we've got an average of 5,000 gold to set aside for whatever.
s;Anil;[Not bad at all.]|[It's been a long time since we've had this big of a budget to work with.]
s;Ecco;Yup! You know what that means?
s;Anil;[Saving up for a rainy day for once?]
s;Ecco;Nope! We're gonna treat ourselves today, Anil!|We absolutely deserve it after all our hard work.
s;Ecco;Come on. Live a little!{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink,Smile} You've been so focused on getting jobs done.|{c:e;Ecco;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}You're gonna die from stress before you're forty.
s;Anil;[I don't think that's how that works.]

s;Ecco;Trust me.|If you don't let yourself indulge in the good things in life,|you're gonna end up regretting it later.|{c:e;Ecco;Smile,NormalBlink}Speaking of indulging,|there's this bakery in town that looked like it had the most delicious pies and tarts.|And you're gonna try them with me whether you want to or not!
s;Ecco;Anil! We got paid today, and you know what that means!
s;Anil;[Another day to splurge, I'm guessing?]
s;Ecco;You know it! Lemme just get my coin pouch then we can--
s;Ecco;No, no, no, no. You can't be serious{tgm}...!{tgm}|My pack's got a hole in it, and my coin pouch isn't in it. And--
s;Anil;[Calm down. We'll just retrace our steps.]|[I'm sure we can find it.]
s;Ecco;Found it! Man, that's a relief.
s;Anil;[Good. Ready to go on your shopping spree, then?]
s;Ecco;Um, n-no, I{tgm}...|{tgm}I just remembered I got other stuff to do today! Gotta go!

s;Ecco;Come on, come on{tgm}...{tgm} My Tiger Amulet has to be here somewhere{tgm}...|{c:e;Ecco;CloseEyes}{tgm}It can't be lost. It just can't{tgm}...!|{c:e;Ecco;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}Maybe I should just{tgm}...{tgm} leave it be?
s;Anil;[Hey, Ecco. This is yours, right?]
s;Ecco;My Tiger Amulet! Anil, thank you, thank you, thank you!|Where did you find this?
s;Anil;[Turns out it fell out of your pack while we were at the bakery the other day.]
s;Ecco;The bakery? Man, I knew I should have checked there first.|But what were you doing there in the first place?
s;Anil;[You seemed anxious lately, so I wanted to get you something to cheer you up.]|[The baker recognized me, so she asked me to give the amulet back to you.]
s;Ecco;Thanks again, Anil. This is a huge load off my mind.
s;Anil;[Well, you seem in good spirits now,]|[so I'll be taking this slice of cherry pie the baker gave me.]
s;Ecco;You got cherry pie?! Let me have a bite!
s;Anil;[Nah, this is all for me.]|{c:e;Anil;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}[Besides, aren't you the one who said I should indulge myself?]
s;Anil;[Here, I'll let you have a bite if you tell me something.]
s;Anil;[Why weren't you honest about losing your Tiger Amulet from the start?]|[You know I would've helped you look for it.]
s;Ecco;I know, but I didn't really know if I wanted to find it again or not.
s;Ecco;That amulet was given to me by the bishops back when I was a monk.|I'm not a devout follower of Oreg anymore,|so what was the point of keeping it around, right?
s;Ecco;But at the same time, it reminds me of all the friends I made back at the temple,|so it's still important to me.|{c:e;Ecco;HalfCloseEyes}I don't really know what to do with it{tgm}...
s;Anil;[Judging by your reaction when I returned it to you, I think the answer's pretty obvious.]
s;Ecco;Yeah, you're right. I'll have to keep it somewhere safer from now on.
s;Anil;[Good. For your honesty, here's your reward.]
s;Ecco;Lemon tart?! You had this on you the entire time?
s;Anil;[Yeah. The baker gave me both.]|{c:e;Anil;Smile}[Just thought I'd mess with you a bit.]
s;Ecco;Ugh, you're the worst.|{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink,Smile}But{tgm}...{tgm} thanks, Anil. Really.
s;Ecco;Whoa, TWO lemon tarts? What's the occasion?
s;Anil;[We had some money saved up. I figured it could fit into the budget.]
s;Ecco;Finally listening to my advice, huh?
s;Anil;[Believe what you want to believe.]|{c:e;Anil;NormalBlink,NoSmile}[And that's not the only thing I got for you.]
s;Ecco;What are you looking at me like that for?
s;Ecco;Wait a minute. Are you{tgm}...|{tgm}Oh, Oreg, are you serious?!
s;Ecco;No, not at all! This was just really sudden.|{c:e;Ecco;HalfCloseEyes}I never expected you'd actually do this like{tgm}...{tgm} ever.

s;Anil;[Ecco, you're the one person I can see myself spending the rest of my life with.]|[I don't want to force you into anything, but with how long we've worked together...]|{c:e;Anil;Smile}[Well, you haven't left yet.]
s;Ecco;Why would I? You're important to me, y'know?
s;Anil;[Still haven't gotten a proper "yes" yet.]
s;Ecco;Oh, just give me a second, alright?{w}{c:e;Ecco;CloseEyes} Ahem.|{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink,Smile}Yes. I will marry you, Anil.

name: SupportKaiTaiga
_source: s;Kai;Yes? And you're Taiga, Ke--Ryuuji's crewmate, correct?
s;Taiga;Yup! With intros outta the way, I got a huge favor to ask.
s;Kai;Might take you up on it, might not. What is it?
s;Taiga;I heard from the captain that you're a pretty smart guy.|So, I wanna see how your smarts compete against my luck in a game of blackjack!
s;Kai;Oh? Sounds like you've got quite a winning streak under your belt already.

s;Taiga;Well, uh{tgm}...{tgm} No. Not really.|{c:e;Taiga;CloseEyes}I've lost every game I've played.|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink,Smile}But that just means my lucky break's gonna be HUGE!|And I have a feeling that it's coming today!
s;Kai;{tgm}...{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}{tgm} You know what, I've got nothing better to do. Deal me in, Taiga.
s;Taiga;Not again{tgm}...!|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}{tgm}One more time! I'm gonna win for sure!
s;Kai;You said that the last five games.
s;Kai;*sigh*{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink} Look, maybe we can play more some other time.|And here, take your money back too. Just be glad we're working together.|I would've pocketed all of this otherwise.
s;Taiga;Man{tgm}...{tgm} Alright.|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}But I'll definitely win next time! I swear it!
s;Kai;I've never seen someone so horrific at gambling before.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,Smile}Although, this does give me an idea{tgm}...
s;Kai;Hey, Taiga! Got a minute? I'm up for a few games of blackjack if you are.
s;Taiga;I'm always up for a game! Let's go!
s;Kai;Before we do, how about we make this more interesting?
s;Kai;The loser has to do whatever the winner tells them to do.
s;Taiga;Whoa there, those are some pretty high stakes.
s;Kai;What are you so worried about?|I thought you said you were definitely gonna win next time. And now's next time.
s;Taiga;Yeah, you're right! My luck's gonna turn around!|{c:e;Taiga;Smile,HalfCloseEyes}But, uh{tgm}...{tgm} Could we make it a best two out of three?
s;Kai;And that's another bust for you.
s;Kai;Hm, now what should I have you do? What if I{tgm}...|{tgm}Should I? No, that might be too much. But{tgm}...{tgm} Hmm{tgm}...
s;Taiga;Oh, out with it already!|Just thinking about what you're gonna make me do is giving me chills.
s;Kai;Alright, alright. I want you to{tgm}...
s;Kai;Tell me everything you know about Ryuuji. No lies and don't leave anything out.

s;Taiga;You sadistic little--|{c:e;Taiga;HalfCloseEyes}Ugh, whatever. A deal's a deal.|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}Anyway, Ryuuji's been captain of the Wyrmfang Pirates for three or so years now.|He wasn't always part of the crew.|We took him prisoner years ago during our last raid on Edoyama.
s;Kai;Speaking of that, why did you stop your raids on the capital?|It would've been a lucrative target.

s;Taiga;Well, we gotta let our targets build up before we knock 'em down, y'know?|Otherwise, there'd be nothing left to steal.|On top of that, Ryuuji outright commanded us to stop raids on the capital|from the moment he was promoted to captain.
s;Taiga;'Course, some of the crew didn't like that, so some of them just up and left.
s;Taiga;He doesn't like talking about himself too much.|The only other stuff I know is that he was working under the imperial family|and just used Ryuuji as a nickname.|His real name's Kenji.
s;Taiga;Man, all that just for some info{tgm}...|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}{tgm}Why do you wanna know so much about him anyway?

name: SupportParkerCole
_source: s;Cole;Greetings, Mister Parker. What's today's lesson?
s;Parker;Hello, Cole.|{c:e;Parker;NoSmile}Considering your skill with Anima magic,|I wanted to cover a more obscure category of Anima.|One must be able to adapt to many combat situations, after all.
s;Cole;The main elements of Anima are Fire, Thunder, and Wind.|{c:e;Cole;NormalBlink}Casting Anima magic involves manipulating the concentrations of these elements.
s;Cole;Fire is highly condensed heat.|Thunder condenses the natural electricity in the air.|And Wind is condensed air particles.
s;Parker;Yes, very good. I see you have been keeping up with your studies.
s;Cole;Thank you, Mister Parker.{c:e;Cole;NoSmile} So, that just leaves Ice magic, right?
s;Parker;Exactly. How Ice magic differs from the others|is that the element is manipulated in the opposite way of the traditional method.
s;Cole;The opposite{tgm}...|{c:e;Cole;NormalBlink}{tgm}Instead of the element being highly condensed, it becomes{tgm}...{tgm} dispersed?

s;Parker;Correct.{c:e;Parker;NoSmile} Ice magic is the result of dispersing an element from a single point.|The concentration of the element is brought down so low that it is practically zero.|With that in mind, which element would make the most sense to result in Ice magic?
s;Cole;Hm{tgm}...{c:e;Cole;NormalBlink}{tgm} Fire?|Ice is cold, and to make something cold, you'd have to take away its heat.
s;Parker;Sound reasoning there, Cole.{c:e;Parker;NormalBlink,Smile} But, sorry to say, that was a trick question.|The correct answer is that all three elements may be dispersed to cast Ice magic.
s;Cole;Wait, how does that make sense?

s;Parker;You see, the point from which the elements are dispersed becomes stagnant.|In that moment, the area has no particles moving within it.|No movement means no energy is being produced.|We would perceive that as a sudden drop in temperature.
s;Cole;In other words, ice forms at that point.
s;Parker;Precisely. Now, shall we start with the practical portion of the lesson?
s;Cole;Yes, sir! I'll do my best.
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 and PKLucky #
s;Parker;{tgm}...{tgm} And that should do it for today's lesson.{w} Any questions?

s;Cole;Yes, but it's more of a curiosity question.|What was the toughest magic duel you ever had?|I know that you're not supposed to just go into battle for the sake of it,|but I'd still like to hear about it.

s;Parker;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} Let's see{tgm}...|{c:e;Parker;NormalBlink}{tgm}I had to deal with a rogue dark mage that was terrorizing towns in northern Medeas.|I ended up confronting him at Port Gildress, and he mainly wielded Nosferatu.

s;Cole;Nosferatu{tgm}...|{tgm}A Dark magic spell that steals the lifeforce of its victims and gives it to the user.|{c:e;Cole;NormalBlink}Wasn't it classified as Light magic years ago?|{c:e;Cole;HalfCloseEyes}In my opinion, it didn't seem all that "light-like" to begin with.

s;Parker;While it was thought to be Light magic,|recent findings led to the conclusion that its origins were older than previously thought.|Hence, it being Light magic is impossible.|{c:e;Parker;CloseEyes}*sigh* Just thinking about it reminds me of how my very essence was being drained away.|{c:e;Parker;NormalBlink}Anyway, the mage's tome had lost its potency after excessive use,|so he began using Luna instead.
s;Cole;A spell that completely bypasses the victim's will and mental endurance.
s;Parker;Correct.|{c:e;Parker;NoSmile}The battle lasted so long that we both exhausted our tomes.|{c:e;Parker;HalfCloseEyes}The local pub got caught in the crossfire as well.
s;Cole;Oh no. Was everyone in there okay?

s;Parker;Thankfully, yes. The patrons and staff were evacuated before the building collapsed.|The situation was getting dire,|so I had to beat the mage with my bare hands to prevent further destruction.
s;Parker;I managed to apprehend him, and the authorities took him away afterward.|{c:e;Parker;CloseEyes}If I didn't think to physically confront him, the situation may have gotten worse.
s;Cole;That sounded intense, Mister Parker.{c:e;Cole;HalfCloseEyes} Sorry for asking.
s;Parker;No need to be sorry. You were just curious.
s;Cole;I'm glad everything turned out okay, though.
s;Parker;Indeed.{w}{c:e;Parker;NoSmile} Let's go ahead and wrap things up for today.|{c:e;Parker;Smile}Keep studying hard, Cole.

s;Cole;I'll need to learn stronger spells for the battles ahead.|{c:e;Cole;NormalBlink}Don't the stronger ones tend to be cast from heavier tomes too?|{c:e;Cole;CloseEyes}If I can lift them AND cast them, then maybe{tgm}...
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 and PKLucky #

name: SupportKristaParker
_source: s;Parker;Ah, Krista. Would you like to play a round or two of chess?|It's been a while since we last played.
s;Krista;Sure!{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes,Smile} And I'm gonna win this time.|I'm wayyy smarter than I was years ago.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink,Smile}I've got totally flawless strategies up my sleeve.
s;Krista;Okay, so we've got a bunch of pawns here, a bunch of pawns there,|both of us still got our queens, but he's down a knight, so...;;;thought_bubble
s;Parker;So locked on that you haven't made your move yet.
s;Krista;There. Perfect position for my bishop.
s;Krista;What are you--|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}Nooooo, you gotta be kidding me{tgm}...!
s;Parker;So, you see it too.|{c:e;Parker;NormalBlink,Smile}I'll go ahead with the move we're both seeing, then.
s;Krista;Fine, whatever. It's just one bishop.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}I can totally bounce back from this!
s;Parker;Good game, Krista.|Your move-by-move analysis of the board has improved since our last game years ago.
s;Parker;Mm-hm.|{c:e;Parker;NormalBlink,Smile}At any rate, I have important business to attend to, so we'll leave it at that.|See you later, Krista. Don't cause too much trouble out there.

name: SupportEccoMasashi
_source: s;Ecco;So many cool things to buy, so little gold to spend.|What's a girl to do?
s;Masashi;Oh, what a dazzling ray of sunshine!
s;Ecco;What the hell?|Can't a girl think without some idiot making comments?
s;Masashi;Most fair of maidens,|you have made this already beautiful day even more dazzling with your presence.
s;Ecco;Uh-huh.{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink} Look, buddy, I'm a little busy right now.|There are plenty of other women around for you to "converse" with.
s;Masashi;Oh? What has consumed your attention so?
s;Ecco;I'm shopping. It's how I unwind.
s;Masashi;Shopping? As in PAYING for things?
s;Ecco;Yeah, whatever, Mason.|{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink}Anyway, I'm trying to decide what to buy.
s;Masashi;A goddess like you shouldn't have to spend money.|Tell me what you want, my lovely lady, and I'll buy it for you.|I can even help you carry your purchases.
s;Ecco;Oh? Why, thank you!|{c:e;Ecco;CloseEyes,Smile}It's so nice for a gentleman to offer to pay for me.
s;Ecco;Now, I need this dress, that platter of pastries,|oh and that pearl necklace{tgm}...
s;Ecco;I thought we could get some pie from the tea shop over there,|some more shoes would be nice too{tgm}...
s;Masashi;Merin, Oreg, Medea, Fueg, Folia, please spare me!;StyleNid=thought_bubble

name: SupportEccoJoshua
_source: s;Joshua;Oh, hey there. Your name's Ecco, right?
s;Ecco;Sure is.|{c:e;Ecco;NoSmile}Now, here's the thing. I'm a mercenary.|Sometimes there just aren't any contracts around to take up and I need money.

s;Joshua;Totally get it.|My old man was a mercenary, and I pick up a couple jobs here and there too.|That said, does it look like I'm made of money to you?|My parents always warned me about giving handouts.
s;Ecco;Not what I was going for here, buddy.|{c:e;Ecco;CloseEyes}Man, what do you take me for?{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink} Some gold digger?
s;Ecco;Anyway, I hear you're an arena fighter.
s;Joshua;Yeah, I got the idea from my dad.|He would supplement arena fights with his mercenary work.
s;Ecco;Smart man.|Anyway, I was wondering if you could get me in. I need a recommendation.

s;Joshua;I don't know about this.|{c:e;Joshua;NormalBlink}Arena fights can be rough. You never know who you'll be up against.|You'll probably be fine against an armored opponent or someone who can use dark magic,|but you can't guarantee you'll be up against someone like that every time.
s;Ecco;Please, I can handle myself.{c:e;Ecco;NormalBlink,Smile} I'm a big girl.
s;Joshua;Really? You look small and slender to me.
s;Ecco;Tell you what. We spar, and if I win, you need to get me into the arena.

name: SupportMasashiHikaru
_source: s;Masashi;Oh, Hikaru{tgm}...{tgm} Our lives surely have taken a turn, haven't they?|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink}One moment, I led Emperor Samegoro's most powerful military unit with you by my side.|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes}And now, we're nothing but lowly soldiers.
s;Hikaru;I do not see what has you so distraught, milord.|You are under the command of Medeas' princess now.|I would have assumed this is nothing but a positive turn of events by your standards.
s;Masashi;You'd think that, but that girl is{tgm}...|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}She's nothing like Lady Tsubaki. Let's just put it that way.

s;Hikaru;That is true.|{c:e;Hikaru;CloseEyes}Lady Tsubaki is quite demure. Mindful, even.|{c:e;Hikaru;NormalBlink}Still, you must look at the positives, milord.|The emperor would have your head if he found out about our failure at Fort Daijima.|You said so yourself.

s;Masashi;Ahh{tgm}...{tgm} Right as always, Hikaru.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile}I suppose having our lives still intact is better than nothing.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes,NoSmile}And yet, that is the bare minimum for relief, is it not?{c:wait;200}{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes} *sigh*
s;Hikaru;As much as I loathe suggesting this, milord, would you{tgm}...|{tgm}feel better if we socialize with the local women of Medeas?
s;Masashi;Hikaru{tgm}...!{c:e;Masashi;Smile}{tgm} Oh, you always know how to brighten up my mood.|Let's be off, then! The beauties of Medeas await us!
s;Masashi;I see{tgm}...{tgm} If an infantry unit were to go in this direction and wait{tgm}...|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}Hm{tgm}...{tgm} but wouldn't it be better if{tgm}...
s;Hikaru;There you are, milord.|I should have guessed you would peruse the Medean Castle's library at some point.
s;Masashi;Hikaru! Good to see you. Care to join me?
s;Masashi;It's a textbook on various war strategies and unit formations.|I was curious about how Medean and Merinese military strategies differ.
s;Hikaru;I see. Anything noteworthy that you've noticed?

s;Masashi;While it is covered, there aren't many specific chapters on maritime combat.|Which is understandable, of course.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}There are some rather{tgm}...{tgm} interesting tactics listed here, such as this formation.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink}While I do see some merit to positioning one's footsoldiers in the forest like this,|wouldn't that leave the fort wide open for an assault?|I think they would have been fine in their initial position.

s;Hikaru;Hmm{tgm}...{c:wait;200}{c:e;Hikaru;NormalBlink}{tgm} Hold on, milord. I think I see what's going on.|Notice how the calvary and pegasus knights are positioned.|They are far enough to be outside of the enemy's range of vision.|By moving the infantry to a nearby forest,|this can bring a false sense of security to the enemy.|With one's own forces out of sight,|that can lead to a successful ambush as the enemy forces approach the fort.
s;Masashi;Aha! I see now. Good eye, Hikaru.|This is why you will always be my second-in-command.
s;Hikaru;You flatter me too much, milord.
s;Masashi;Oh, I also wanted your opinion on this maneuver.
s;Hikaru;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} Now, this one looks fascinating{tgm}...
s;Hikaru;O Great Merin, may you bless this day and grant us protection.
s;Hikaru;Thank you again for joining me, Lord Masashi.
s;Masashi;No need to thank me, Hikaru. I enjoy being together with you in prayer.|It's the only time I get to see you without that permanent scowl on your face.
s;Masashi;And there it is again.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile}My dear Hikaru, you must understand that while I do jest,|it does seem you are most calm when addressing the Great Merin.
s;Hikaru;Knowing that she watches over us does put my mind at ease.|{c:e;Hikaru;CloseEyes}"For she is the anchor in the roughest storms."
s;Masashi;Always on top of knowing the scriptures.|I never would expect less from you, Hikaru.
s;Hikaru;Again, you flatter me too much, milord.|This is something a priest such as myself should know at minimum.
s;Masashi;While that may be true,|I do not believe that should stop me from admiring your devotion.
s;Hikaru;You could easily say that about any other devoted priest of Merin, milord.
s;Masashi;I don't believe I could.|{c:e;Masashi;Smile}Because they're not you, Hikaru.
s;Masashi;And the scowl disappears once again.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Perhaps I should praise you more to keep it away?
s;Masashi;You know, Hikaru, you're getting up there in age--
s;Hikaru;I am barely older than you are, milord, but go on.
s;Masashi;Haven't you considered looking for a wife?
s;Hikaru;Quite frankly, no, milord.|My religious studies and being your second-in-command|already occupy a lot of my time.|Adding a spouse to the picture will just be too much.
s;Masashi;But what about all those times you have been my wingman?|{c:e;Masashi;Smile}I'm sure at least one of those stunning beauties caught your eye at least once.
s;Hikaru;I am not obsessed with women like you are, milord.

s;Masashi;I will choose to ignore that remark.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink}However, Hikaru, please understand.|I am not saying this as your superior, but as your friend.|I don't want you to be alone and unhappy in the future.

s;Hikaru;Milord, I promise you that I am happy with the way I'm living now.|And I won't be alone because I'll have you.|{c:e;Hikaru;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Unless you want to hire another right-hand man anytime soon?
s;Masashi;I wouldn't dream of it.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,NoSmile}But what about when I find a wife of my own? It will happen someday, I'm sure.

s;Hikaru;"A fisherman who casts will eventually reel something in," as the saying goes{tgm}...|{c:e;Hikaru;NormalBlink}{tgm}That aside, The Great Merin provides some company as well.|Her teachings will always provide comfort.|You need not worry about me, Lord Masashi.|{c:e;Hikaru;Smile}Though, part of me is glad you show so much concern for my well-being.|I am grateful to have someone like you in my life.
s;Masashi;I can say the same to you, Hikaru. And you're right. I have nothing to worry about.|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes,Smile}You have already found fulfillment despite your young age.
s;Hikaru;Didn't you just say that I am "getting up there"?
s;Masashi;You are barely older than I am, though. You've still got some youth in you.

name: SupportMasashiTsubaki
_source: s;Masashi;Ah, Lady Tsubaki!|What a pleasure it is for you to grace me with your presence.
s;Tsubaki;Oh, um, yes.|It's{tgm}...{tgm} er{tgm}...{tgm} good to see you too.
s;Masashi;Did you need something of me?|I know that seeing your lovely face has already made my day brighter.
s;Masashi;I must say,|it's truly a miraculous occasion to have a private moment with you, Lady Tsubaki.|In fact, why don't we chat over a cup of tea?|I know this one cafe nearby that--
s;Tsubaki;You know what, I just remembered that I had some other business to attend to.
s;Masashi;Oh, really? Well, perhaps we could--
s;Tsubaki;I-I'm sorry, Lord Masashi.|Maybe we can talk some other time. S-Sorry!
s;Masashi;L-Lady Tsubaki?|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes}Did I do something wrong?{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink} I feel like I barely got a word in.

s;Tsubaki;So the rumors were true.{c:e;Tsubaki;HalfCloseEyes} He is nothing but a shameless flirt!|{c:e;Tsubaki;CloseEyes}*sigh* I was hoping that maybe he was different.|{c:e;Tsubaki;HalfCloseEyes}Perhaps that was why Father said to stay away from him.
s;Masashi;Lady Tsubaki! So good to see you again.|I feared that you have been avoiding me lately.
s;Masashi;{tgm}...{tgm} Ah.{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes} That IS the case, isn't it?
s;Masashi;Please, say no more.{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile} I completely understand.

s;Masashi;I see that my reputation has preceded me.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile}But I assure you that there will be none of that today.|{c:e;Masashi;NoSmile}I apologize if I was too bold during our first conversation.
s;Tsubaki;Oh.|{c:e;Tsubaki;HalfCloseEyes}But still, I'm not sure if I can trust you to keep your word.|{c:e;Tsubaki;NormalBlink}I'm sorry.

s;Masashi;Don't be. Like I said, I can understand your hesitancy.|But, I would like to get to know you more, Lady Tsubaki. Truly.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes,NoSmile}It's just that I wasn't allowed to talk about you or even meet up with you before.
s;Tsubaki;Wait, why weren't you allowed to see me?|Other than my father having your head if you did?
s;Masashi;I'm not exactly sure, but I do have my theories.
s;Masashi;On one hand, I may be biased on this conclusion considering who it involves.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}But at the same time, I don't see any other possibilities.
s;Tsubaki;Who are you thinking of, Lord Masashi?
s;Masashi;Before we tackle that,|let us make sure we're on the same page about something first.|Emperor Samegoro had someone in mind for you to wed when the time came, yes?
s;Tsubaki;Of course. The arrangement was decided around ten years ago, I believe.|{c:e;Tsubaki;CloseEyes}Though, now that you mention it,|the marriage was called off only a couple years afterward.
s;Masashi;Lady Tsubaki, I was the one you would have been wed to.

s;Tsubaki;Y-You?! I-I mean, no offense, Lord Masashi, but my father hated you.|{c:e;Tsubaki;CloseEyes}At least, I thought he did.|{c:e;Tsubaki;NormalBlink}Why would he have considered you as a possible marriage candidate?

s;Masashi;I believe there was someone who was pulling strings here.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}Someone who wanted to keep me away from you.|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes}No, keep me away from ANYONE.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}I{tgm}...{tgm} I can't think of anyone else who it could be.

s;Masashi;It's{tgm}...{tgm} It's one of the strategists who worked under my father.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink}She was my tutor and practically my caretaker|since my parents were always busy with political matters.|And just having a connection to my family was enough to have some influence.

s;Tsubaki;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} I can see how she could do this, but WHY would she?|{c:e;Tsubaki;NormalBlink}Your family has great military prowess and influence|over the northeastern region of Merinas.|If anything, our union would only be a benefit.|I'm sure anyone who has some insight into political affairs can see that.|{c:e;Tsubaki;CloseEyes}So, why{tgm}...?
s;Masashi;I{tgm}...{tgm} I'm sorry, Lady Tsubaki.|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}I{tgm}...{tgm} I can't{tgm}...
s;Masashi;I-I have to go. I apologize. I just{tgm}...|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink}{tgm}I'm sorry!
s;Tsubaki;Ah, wait!|{tgm}{c:e;Tsubaki;CloseEyes}...{tgm} Lord Masashi, what happened to you{tgm}...?
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 and PKLucky #

name: SupportAnnaJake
_source: s;Anna;Jake, there's something really important you need to know.
s;Jake;Huh, if you're saying it like that, it's gotta be real serious.
s;Anna;Just please promise me you won't freak out when I tell you.
s;Jake;Aw, come on already! Just say it!|You're making me worry here.
s;Anna;Alright, here goes{tgm}...{c:e;Anna;NormalBlink,Smile}{tgm} Jake, I{tgm}...|{c:e;Anna;NoSmile}{tgm}You're going to be a father.
s;Anna;You're gonna be a father, Jake! I'm pregnant!

s;Jake;No, no, I get that! It's just{tgm}...|{tgm}When? How??|{c:e;Jake;CloseEyes}I mean, I know HOW.|{c:e;Jake;NormalBlink}But when did this happen?|All this time, we've been too busy to do anything.
s;Anna;Remember that one night before we got roped into this adventure?|{c:e;Anna;HalfCloseEyes}That one night when we had you in a--
s;Jake;Ohhhhhhh. Yeah, that checks out.|{c:e;Jake;CloseEyes,Smile}But, wow. Me, a father{tgm}...|{tgm}That's{tgm}...{tgm} wow.|{c:e;Jake;NoSmile,NormalBlink}I just wish I knew about this sooner.
s;Anna;And have you fretting over your girlfriend this entire time?|No way!
s;Anna;And there's still not a thing to worry about now.|I've been taking care of myself just fine.|We're gonna have a family, Jake. I'll make sure of it.
s;Jake;Right! And don't forget I'm gonna be here every step of the way too!

name: SupportAnnaXiang
_source: s;Anna;Well, hey there, Xiang! Whatcha up to there?
s;Xiang;Ah, hello, Anna.|I am performing a daily divination ritual.|I do this each morning to get an outlook on how the rest of the day fares.
s;Anna;Ohhh, cool stuff! So, how does this work?|Anything special going on with these cards?

s;Xiang;Each card in this deck has a different meaning.|The one I just drew, "The Drake", represents the concept of cycles and transitions.|It could either mean more of the same is in store for me today,|or there will be a change in routine.|{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}I will just have to stay aware of such things.
s;Anna;That's really fascinating.|{c:e;Anna;NoSmile}Say, have you ever thought of doing this for other people?
s;Anna;People out there might like a forecast on how their day goes, y'know?|And you could be their go-to person to give them that foresight.
s;Xiang;I don't know{tgm}...|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}{tgm}This is something I typically only do for myself.

s;Anna;You'd be doing people a service, Xiang!|I think everyone would be happier if they knew how to tackle the day.|Plus, if we charge for it, that just means more funds for the army to work with too.
s;Xiang;Since you put it that way, maybe I'll consider it.
s;Anna;Great!{c:e;Anna;CloseEyes} Oh, this is exciting.|{c:e;Anna;NormalBlink}I'm gonna make flyers and everything!|I'll let you know when I'm done with the prep work on my end.
s;Xiang;Ah, Anna, I said "maybe"!|{tgm}{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}...{w}{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm} Usually, the predictions don't happen this fast.
s;Anna;Hey, Xiang! So? How's the fortune-telling business treating you?
s;Xiang;I'm exhausted.{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes} I've had no time to myself for a week straight.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}Just how many people did you advertise this to?

s;Anna;I hung a flyer or two{tgm}...{c:e;Anna;CloseEyes,Smile}{tgm} Or three{tgm}...|{c:e;Anna;HalfCloseEyes,NoSmile}{tgm}Maybe closer to a dozen in the castle town's marketplace.|{c:e;Anna;NormalBlink}It's a high-traffic area, y'know? More eyes means more business.
s;Xiang;Too much business, in my opinion.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}This cannot be the only thing I do in my free time, Anna.|I have a life outside of this.
s;Anna;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} You do have a point.
s;Anna;Oh, here's an idea! How about I help you manage things?|I can figure out timeslots, handle the finances, all the clerical stuff!|That way, all you have to worry about is the readings.
s;Xiang;Well, that will help a lot--
s;Anna;Okay! Time to get some new flyers made.

s;Xiang;Maybe I should do a quick self-reading. That's always relaxing.|{tgm}{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}...{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}{tgm} "The Turtle," but it's upside-down.{w} Emotional instability{tgm}...|{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm}*sigh* I could have figured that one out on my own.
s;Anna;Xiang, what's going on? I thought you were completely booked today.|Where is everyone?
s;Xiang;I canceled all my appointments for the day.
s;Anna;You what?! But all those clients--
s;Xiang;Can find someone else to read their fortunes.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}I did some research and found others who do similar readings to mine.
s;Anna;But why? You were really popular, Xiang!
s;Xiang;That never mattered to me. I was only in it to help others.|I do not want to shoulder that burden on my own if I can help it.
s;Anna;Well, I guess it is ultimately your decision.|{c:e;Anna;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}But man, we were making so much gold off of this{tgm}...
s;Xiang;As I've said before, these readings were something I did solely for myself.|I find them therapeutic. It's something I do to self-reflect each day.
s;Anna;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} I get it now.|{c:e;Anna;NormalBlink,Smile}Sorry for taking that away from you, Xiang. I wasn't thinking.
s;Xiang;Now that you understand, would you like me to do a reading for you?
s;Xiang;Though I do readings for myself,|I do not mind performing the occasional reading for a friend.|Especially if it seems like they need time to reflect on things.
s;Anna;That's really kind of you, Xiang. Thanks.
s;Xiang;Now, is there anything currently on your mind? Anything that's troubling you?

s;Anna;Well, other than this business venture falling through, there is something{tgm}...|{c:e;Anna;NormalBlink,Smile}{tgm}How's my future with Jake looking?|I don't want to go into the details, but I just wanna know how things turn out.
s;Xiang;I see. For this, I'll do a three-card reading|rather than the typical one-card readings I do for my daily fortune-telling.|A topic like this needs more insight.
s;Xiang;Allow me to shuffle the deck.
s;Anna;Let's see, I'll pick this one, this one, and{tgm}...{tgm} that one.

s;Xiang;Now, I'll flip each card over one by one.|The first card represents how your relationship is currently faring.|You chose "The Phoenix." It signifies passion and energy.|{c:e;Xiang;Smile}I don't think there's any arguing about what this is implying.

s;Xiang;The next card represents a possible future for this relationship.|For this, you chose "The Wyrm." This one symbolizes stability and growth.|There won't be major problems on the road ahead, from what I can tell.|And the "growth" part can range from the physical to the emotional.
s;Xiang;And finally, the final card will bridge the gap between the current state and the future.|The card you chose was "The Serpent."|This represents taking the initiative.
s;Anna;I see{tgm}...{tgm} Yeah, I think I know what I need to do.|{c:e;Anna;NoSmile}Thanks, Xiang. Mind if we do this again sometime?|I'll be sure not to ask you too often.
s;Xiang;I would be glad to, Anna.

name: SupportTrevorAzure
_source: s;Trevor;Azure, I must say, you are the most beautiful man I have ever laid my eyes upon.
s;Azure;Is this an attempt at courtship, Trevor?|If so, I applaud your boldness, but your technique needs work.
s;Trevor;No! I mean, not that I would not consider the possibility--|Th-That is to say{tgm}...|{c:e;Trevor;HalfCloseEyes}...{tgm} May I reattempt initiating this conversation?
s;Trevor;Thank you.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}As I was trying to say, your beauty has a certain feminine quality to it,|and yet you're still a man.
s;Trevor;I wish to be as confident in my own masculinity as you are.|How do you do it, Azure?{br}Please teach me your ways!
s;Azure;Is that all? You should have just started with that.|And there's nothing to it, really. I was born a man, and that's just how I am.
s;Trevor;I{tgm}...{tgm} I see. Thank you for your wisdom, Azure.|At any rate, that was all I wished to speak with you about.|I shall take my leave now.
s;Azure;He didn't seem satisfied with that. But what else could I have said?|I only spoke the truth.|{c:e;Azure;CloseEyes}I wonder what sort of answer he's looking for?

name: SupportTrevorMasashi
_source: s;Masashi;Ah, Trevor, my good man.|What say you and I hit the town and do some{tgm}...{tgm} sightseeing?
s;Trevor;Wonderful idea, Lord Masashi. I can guide you around.
s;Masashi;Perfect.|You wouldn't happen to know of places|where those of the fairer sex and graceful mannerisms frequent,|would you?
s;Trevor;"The fairer sex"?{c:e;Trevor;HalfCloseEyes} Are you referring to women?

s;Masashi;No need to be so crass, my fellow man. But{tgm}...{tgm} yes and no.|{c:e;Masashi;Smile}There's women and then there's LADIES!|We must scout out and observe the ladies, Trevor.|Make sure they are up to standard.
s;Trevor;Oh{tgm}...{tgm} Ha ha{tgm}...{tgm} Yes, well, that sounds{tgm}...{tgm} lovely, Lord Masashi.|But I'm not sure if I'm the man for the job.
s;Masashi;Nonsense!|I can sense that you have a certain knack for dealing with fair maidens.
s;Trevor;Wh-What do you--I mean, er, thank you? I think?
s;Masashi;Trust me, Trevor, you will be a wonderful wingman.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile}With your natural charm and my refined skills in flirtation, we'll make quite the team.
s;Trevor;Alright, fine.{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink} I will accompany you just this once, Lord Masashi.|{c:e;Trevor;HalfCloseEyes}ONLY this once.
s;Masashi;A fruitful expedition, if I do say so myself!
s;Trevor;You were slapped by two women and one threw her drink at you.
s;Masashi;We are ignoring that.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,Smile}But you, Trevor! You had all the ladies fawning over you.
s;Trevor;Not that I really wanted to in the first place.
s;Trevor;Ah, nothing.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}At any rate, I will be taking my leave. I am glad you enjoyed yourself, Lord Masashi.
s;Masashi;We absolutely must do this again.
s;Trevor;What?! Lord Masashi, with all due respect,|we agreed that this is the only time we would do this together, did we not?
s;Masashi;I know, but I cannot possibly let go of my best wingman. Please, Trevor!
s;Trevor;*sigh*{w}{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink} Alright, Lord Masashi. We may do this again.
s;Masashi;Excellent! Until next time then, Trevor.
s;Trevor;Do I tell him? Do I explain why I'm not suited to these ventures?|{c:e;Trevor;HalfCloseEyes}But if I do, it could ruin everything.|{c:e;Trevor;CloseEyes}Oh Medea, what am I gonna do?

s;Masashi;Trevor seemed so awkward and tense when we were out earlier.|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes}He may be new to this sort of thing, but I wonder if there's something else to it{tgm}...{tgm} Hm{tgm}...|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}And why do I find him surprisingly attractive?|How come my{tgm}...{tgm} quiver gets hard whenever I'm around him?

name: SupportKaiTsurugi
_source: s;Tsurugi;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} So this pack of merchandise is going{tgm}...
s;Tsurugi;Or, wait, was that town down this road?{c:e;Tsurugi;CloseEyes} Hm{tgm}...
s;Kai;Hey, Tsurugi. Looking a little lost there.
s;Tsurugi;Oh, Mister Kai! Fancy seeing you here.|What might you be up to?
s;Kai;Nothing in particular, just passing through.|But looks like you need a little help there.
s;Tsurugi;Uh, yes, actually.|I have this delivery to make, but I don't remember how to get to this town.
s;Kai;Well, it'll help if you hold the map right-side up.
s;Kai;So, you'd take that road, follow it for about half a mile,|turn left at the fork, and there you are.
s;Tsurugi;Thank you very much, Mister Kai.|I was never really good at reading maps or navigation in general.
s;Kai;Huh. Makes me wonder how you make those deliveries on time.
s;Kai;{tgm}...{tgm} I see.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Maybe I should accompany you. Just to make sure you don't get lost.
s;Tsurugi;I'd really appreciate that. Thank you, Mister Kai!|You're still as kind as I remember.
s;Kai;You're acting like we've met before again.|Have we, Tsurugi?
s;Kai;Hm? What are you talking about?
s;Tsurugi;Oh, uh, I-I mean--Anyway, let's get going!
s;Kai;Wonder what he was going on about just now?
s;Kai;Man, I'd better catch up to him, though. He might get lost again.
s;Tsurugi;Let's see, we'll put this book in this pocket, then--
s;Kai;That book looked rather interesting.|A collection of Merinese folktales, was it?
s;Tsurugi;Yes! There's one folktale in here that's an absolute favorite of mine.|It's commonly called "The Crane's Gift". Have you heard of it?
s;Kai;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Possibly.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}Is it the one where a farmer nurses an injured crane back to health|and the crane transforms into a beautiful woman?

s;Tsurugi;Yup, that's it!|In some versions of the tale,|the crane gives the farmer expensive cloth made from her feathers|in exchange for his kind gesture.|But I'd say my favorite iteration is when the crane marries the farmer.|It's quite romantic.
s;Kai;Heh, into the sappy stuff, aren't ya, Tsurugi?
s;Tsurugi;"Sappy"?!|{c:e;Tsurugi;CloseEyes}I mean, you're not wrong, I suppose.|{c:e;Tsurugi;HalfCloseEyes}But, there's more to it than that.
s;Kai;Oh? What, you wanna have a crane for a wife?
s;Tsurugi;Mister Kai, please stop twisting my words!|{c:e;Tsurugi;NormalBlink}And it's not that, it's more like--
s;Kai;Well, now you got me curious, Tsurugi.
s;Tsurugi;Oh no no no I shouldn't have let my mouth run like that!|Why do you have this effect on me?|{c:e;Tsurugi;HalfCloseEyes}If we keep up this conversation, I might end up saying that we--
s;Tsurugi;Agh, not again!!|{c:e;Tsurugi;NormalBlink}I have to go! Sorry, Mister Kai!!

s;Kai;Every time I talk to this guy, the more weird he gets, I swear{tgm}...|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes,Smile}{tgm}Heh. Not that I'm complaining.{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,Smile} I'd go so far as to say it's his charm point.
s;Tsurugi;Thanks again for coming with me for these delivery runs, Mister Kai.|It's been helping a lot!
s;Kai;No problem.|We just gotta keep going down this road, then--
s;Bandit1;Hand over the goods and no one gets hurt.
s;Tsurugi;M-Mister Kai, what do we do?
s;Kai;Just stick close to me, Tsurugi. I've got this.
s;Tsurugi;Y-Yes. Thank you, Mister Kai.|{c:e;Tsurugi;HalfCloseEyes}If you weren't here, I{tgm}...
s;Kai;Don't even worry about it.|I'm a mercenary by trade. It's what I do.
s;Tsurugi;I know, but I can defend myself.|Really, I swear!|{c:e;Tsurugi;HalfCloseEyes}I-I just{tgm}...{tgm} got scared.
s;Kai;Hey. Don't feel like you have to push yourself.|{c:e;Kai;Smile}I'm gonna be here for you, Tsurugi.
s;Tsurugi;N-Never mind.{c:e;Tsurugi;CloseEyes} I almost let my mouth run again.
s;Kai;You know, I COULD figure out what you're hiding,|but I like seeing you get flustered from almost letting your secrets out.
s;Tsurugi;Mister Kai, about{tgm}...|{c:e;Tsurugi;CloseEyes}{tgm}Well, I'm sure you know what I want to say.
s;Kai;Yeah. You being a Crane Shifter, and all that?
s;Tsurugi;What do you mean, "and"?|Aren't you at least upset that I hid that from you?
s;Kai;Not particularly.|It's understandable why you wouldn't want that fact out in the open.|{c:e;Kai;Smile}If anything, it makes me curious about something.
s;Tsurugi;No offense, Mister Kai, but you're always curious about something.

s;Kai;Heh, fair enough.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,NoSmile}But as I was saying, I started thinking about that one folktale. "The Crane's Gift".|Now, correct me if I'm wrong,|but I assume you like it so much because you experienced something similar to the story,|didn't you?
s;Tsurugi;Right you are, Mister Kai. That's exactly it.
s;Kai;So close to living out an actual fairy tale, aren't you, Tsurugi?
s;Tsurugi;Oh come on, don't tease me like that{tgm}...
s;Kai;Sorry, sorry.|But seriously, I gotta ask: who was the "farmer" who helped you?
s;Tsurugi;It{tgm}...{tgm} It was you, Mister Kai.
s;Tsurugi;It was a few years ago. But considering what form I was in,|I wouldn't be surprised if you didn't realize it was me.

s;Kai;"Your form," huh{tgm}...?|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}{tgm}You know, now that you mention it,|I do remember a crane with a broken wing resting in the castle garden by the pond{tgm}...|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}{tgm}You're saying that was you this entire time?

s;Tsurugi;Yes. I wanted to repay you back then, but I had to hurry back home before I could.|{c:e;Tsurugi;Smile}And now, I finally get to see you again.|You're still as kind as I remember,{br}Mister Kai.
s;Kai;Heh, seems like every part of my past is catching up to me. Even this.|{c:e;Kai;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}I guess this is what I get for running away from it.
s;Kai;Hey, I'm not saying I hated everything about my past.|I'm glad I could help you back then, Tsurugi. You seem well off now.|It's good to see you again. Really.
s;Tsurugi;Mister Kai{tgm}...{c:e;Tsurugi;CloseEyes,Smile}{tgm} Thank you.|{c:e;Tsurugi;NormalBlink,Smile}I'm only here now because of you.

name: SupportViolaMasashi
_source: s;Viola;There you are, Mello. A nice juicy apple for you.|I even sprinkled some sugar on it just for you.
s;Viola;There you are!|Who's my favorite girl? Who's my favorite girl? YOU'RE my favorite girl!
s;Masashi;Oh magnificent heavens,|who is this perfect example of grace, poise, and loveliness?

s;Masashi;Oh, did I startle you, madam? I'm dreadfully sorry.|{c:e;Masashi;Smile}I am Masashi, a shogun of Merinas.|I just couldn't stay silent after seeing the grace and poise you possess.|Especially after seeing how you look after your steed.
s;Masashi;Oh my, graceful AND humble?|Madam, you are a diamond amongst rubble, mere coal even.|Would you be interested in a pot of tea later? Perhaps around lunch?
s;Masashi;Even your pegasus has gotten excited.|I'll see you later, then. Until next time.
s;Viola;He seems nice.|{c:e;Viola;CloseEyes,Smile}Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Tea would be good.{c:e;Viola;NormalBlink,Smile} I hope there's plenty of sugar.
s;Viola;Now, that's not very nice to say.|We don't even know him well enough to say if that's true or not.
s;Viola;Wait, what? Mello, please!|He just wants to have tea and maybe some biscuits or something.

name: SupportKristaChell
_source: s;KristaShirtless;Hey, Chell!|I wasn't expecting to meet my favorite Pegasus knight here.
s;ChellShirtless;Heh. You say that to every knight in your service, but thank you.|I like to relax in the sauna after a good training session.
s;KristaShirtless;Same here.|Your shoulders look great! I didn't realize how good they were.
s;ChellShirtless;Please, Your Highness.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;NormalBlink}On that note, your back is looking good.|How is your swordsmanship with Kai going?
s;KristaShirtless;Going good! He's very quick with a blade.|Speaking of which, how's your axe training going?

s;ChellShirtless;It's going well. It must be where the shoulder muscles are coming from.|Anyway, if you ever want to train together, I'm at your service.|I'm sure we could learn a lot from each other.
s;KristaShirtless;Sure! I'd like that.|Besides, I can see your thunder thighs in action.
s;ChellShirtless;Your thighs are pretty good as well, Your Highness. I'll see you next time.
s;Krista;Off to the sauna again, Chell?
s;Chell;Why, yes. Would you like to join me?
s;KristaShirtless;Man, I didn't think it'd be possible,|but I think you got even buffer since the last time we were in the sauna together.

s;ChellShirtless;Hm? I might be. I have been incorporating more meat into my diet.|And with all the extra training and practice spars, it's not too surprising.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;Smile}On that note, you've been getting more muscle definition as well.|Your back muscles especially.
s;KristaShirtless;Really?|I can't get a good look at them myself, so I'll take your word for it.
s;ChellShirtless;Speaking of training, still going well, I take it?
s;ChellShirtless;That's good.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;NoSmile}You know, despite you switching teachers multiple times,|I can still see my father's influence on your technique.

s;ChellShirtless;Your defensive maneuvers are similar to Forrest's.|And you've gotten more swift with the blade after Kai started to teach you.|And, the power you put into your swings was from my father's teachings, wasn't it?
s;KristaShirtless;Sure was.|Ol' man Gibson always did say the best defense is a good offense.
s;ChellShirtless;Yes, that sounds like something Father would say.
s;KristaShirtless;Gibson was a good man.|I still miss him, but it must be a lot tougher for you.
s;ChellShirtless;That is true. I miss him dearly.|But I cannot let that weigh down on me.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;CloseEyes}I won't allow it to.

s;ChellShirtless;Father, why? Why did you have to die like that? You were so strong.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;CloseEyes}Sam tried to avenge you and he got some of them, but{tgm}...|{c:e;ChellShirtless;NormalBlink}{tgm}I will get stronger, Father. I will stamp them into dust.
s;ChellShirtless;Hya! Hrah! Hoo-ah! I will kill them all!!
s;Krista;Chell? Was that you just now?
s;ChellShirtless;Oh, it's you, Your Highness. Pardon me. Let me get my shirt on.
s;Krista;There's no need. It's just us.|What are you doing training so late?|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}And all that yelling earlier{tgm}...{tgm} I caught some of it, but{tgm}...

s;ChellShirtless;I had a nightmare about that day and I couldn't go back to sleep.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;NormalBlink}Sometimes when I'm too angry or restless, I come here and train.{w} Really train.|But with how hard I go, I work up a sweat and let my feelings out.|So I only do training like this at night when no one is around.
s;Krista;You want those bandits killed, don't you?|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}It's not about justice. You want them dead and rotting somewhere, right?
s;ChellShirtless;{tgm}...{tgm} Yes.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;HalfCloseEyes}I'm sad to say, but it's true.
s;Krista;What I should do is reprimand you.|Tell you vengeance isn't the answer, or spout out some other cliche.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}But I'm not gonna.

s;Krista;Because I understand.|How sometimes anger boils up inside you and you gotta let it out somehow.|{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes}It's hard to keep that sort of thing down. Especially when it's that intense.

s;Krista;All I ask is that you rethink your reasons for going after them.|Getting rid of evil-doers is good on paper,|but you gotta think about the motivation behind the act, too.|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}I just don't want to let you lose yourself to your anger, Chell.|You might end up doing something you regret.
s;Krista;You don't have to come to any conclusions right away.|But when you feel like you're ready,|I'll be there to back you up no matter what you end up deciding to do.

s;ChellShirtless;Your Highness{tgm}...{tgm} Thank you.|I'll keep honing my strength until then.|{c:e;ChellShirtless;CloseEyes}One day, I will bring peace to my parents with no regrets.{c:e;ChellShirtless;NormalBlink}{w} I swear it.

name: SupportTrevorSam
_source: s;Trevor;Ah Sam, my lusty axe fighter! How did you come into possession of a Wind tome?|And what were you doing with it exactly?|You seem to have no magical potential to speak of.
s;Sam;I took it from a bandit's corpse.
s;Trevor;Ah yes, of course.|But why keep it at your cabin? Why not sell it?
s;Sam;I found that if I kept it open, it kept the cabin cool during the summer.|Quite the breeze too.
s;Trevor;I beg your pardon? You kept it to cool off your house?
s;Sam;Sure did. The old place gets hot in the summer.|{c:e;Sam;Smile}Oh, there was a Fire tome too.
s;Trevor;Please don't say you used that to keep the cabin warm in the winter.
s;Sam;Nope, I used it to cook with!
s;Trevor;What?? What did you do?|Tear it up and use its pages as ignition fuel?

s;Sam;No man, that's crazy. Only someone inept at starting a campfire does that.|{c:e;Sam;Smile}I found that if I struck a piece of wood across the book,|it would catch on fire and then the rest is easy.
s;Trevor;That is even worse.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}Thank you, my boisterous friend.|This conversation has been enlightening, but I need to take a reprieve.
s;Sam;Why was he upset about me finding practical uses for all this junk?|It's not like I could use it any other way.
s;Trevor;Was I assuming things wrong? 'Cause if that was what was goin' on, then{tgm}...{tgm} Hm{tgm}...
s;Sam;Trevor! Figures that you'd be here with your nose in a book.
s;Trevor;S-Sam?! You startled me. What're--|I mean, what may you be doing in the castle library?
s;Sam;Wanted to find something for a light read. What are you up to?
s;Trevor;Reviewing the fundamentals of magic.|Quite frankly, our conversation the other day has vexed me for some time now.
s;Sam;Got a problem with how I used those tomes?

s;Trevor;Not exactly.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}Though your activation methods were{tgm}...{tgm} unconventional,|the tomes you acquired were able to perform their intended functions.|Yet, you have no magical potential to speak of.
s;Trevor;Magical tomes act as amplifiers to a user's magic potential.|If there is no potential, then they simply won't work.
s;Trevor;You cannot create something out of nothing, Sam. That is just simple logic at work.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}With that in mind, I realized the answer I sought was in front of me all along!
s;Sam;I don't like where this is going{tgm}...
s;Trevor;Sam, my dear friend, you actually DO have magical potential within yourself!|That is why I would like to propose--
s;Sam;Nope. Nuh-uh. I'm not hearing it.
s;Sam;Trevor, I ain't gonna start using some stupid spells|just because you figured out that I could.
s;Trevor;That is not what I was about to say at all!|You are much too proficient with the axe to even consider quitting that.
s;Sam;Huh. Color me surprised. Then, what were you gonna say?
s;Trevor;I would like to closely observe you using your tomes.|You may be doing something that even the most learned scholars have not thought of.
s;Sam;You're just gonna observe? No weird experiments or anything?
s;Sam;And I don't.|{c:e;Sam;Smile,NormalBlink}Alright, Trevor, you can watch me use them.|I'll let you know when I've got some free time.

name: SupportSamJoshua
_source: s;Sam;Thanks, man. Yours is awesome too.
s;Sam;Nice sword. Do you always carry that massive thing around?
s;Joshua;Folks kept asking me to shave until I started carrying Old Iron around.|What about you? Do you always carry that axe around?
s;Sam;People would start asking me to shave if I didn't.
s;Sam;Sure! What are we training today?
s;Joshua;Arms. Every day is arm day.

name: SupportSamCole
_source: s;Cole;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} Uh-huh{tgm}...{tgm} So that's how that works{tgm}...
s;Cole;Huh? What? Uh, yes{tgm}...?{tgm} May I help you?
s;Sam;What do you think you're doing?
s;Sam;See, that's your FIRST problem.|{c:e;Sam;NormalBlink}Magic is absolutely useless out there on the battlefield.
s;Cole;Huh? What are you talking about?|I've seen the mages in this army make great contributions in combat.
s;Sam;A REAL man goes out there and takes on his enemies head-on!|Only cowards use stinkin' MAGIC to fight their battles.
s;Cole;Mister Parker isn't a coward. He's one of the bravest people I know.
s;Sam;Pfft-- Sure.|{c:e;Sam;NormalBlink}Look, kid, you need a new perspective on what it means to be a REAL man.|{c:e;Sam;Smile}And I can show you!
s;Sam;To the training yard! I'm teaching you how to swing an axe!

name: SupportSamMasashi
_source: s;Masashi;Sam, you are a fellow appreciator of the female form, correct?
s;Sam;Are you asking if I like girls? Don't all guys do?|{c:e;Sam;CloseEyes}Anyway, I don't like where this is going{tgm}...
s;Masashi;Let's go into town, find a nice restaurant, and woo some lovely maidens.|{c:e;Masashi;NoSmile}First, though, you need to get a shirt on.
s;Masashi;But the staff won't let you in otherwise!
s;Sam;Then find a place that's less picky.

s;Masashi;So now that we're here, you can see there are several lovely-looking ladies.|{c:e;Masashi;Smile,CloseEyes}But don't be hasty in your pursuit.|{c:e;Masashi;Smile,NormalBlink}You must observe the maiden. Watch her mannerisms.|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes,Smile}Ensure she has grace, charm, and is a proper, cultured lady.
s;Sam;We've only met. We're hardly friends yet.

s;Masashi;Irrelevant, my companion.|{c:e;Masashi;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Now, to answer to your baseborn question,|you don't want to get with some mannerless oaf|who can't tell which fork to use at the table!|{c:e;Masashi;Smile}She must have some refinement, manners, grace of movement. A *lady*!
s;BuffBarmaid;Pardon me, gents! Would either of you like a refill?
s;BuffBarmaid;Not a problem at all, good sir!
s;Masashi;And THAT is exactly what I'm talking about. How crude!|{c:e;Masashi;HalfCloseEyes}Such a cur, that one. I'd look elsewhere.
s;Sam;Yeah, but did you see how thick her legs were? And those shoulders!|She could carry a beer barrel with one arm!
s;Sam;She's buff, Masashi. Did I stutter?
s;Masashi;By Merin, what kind of a wingman is this man? He has no taste!;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Sam;Oh, she's swinging by again! One sec.
s;BuffBarmaid;In two hours I will be, handsome.
s;Masashi;H-He actually--?!|{c:e;Masashi;CloseEyes}Dear Merin, what am I to do?
s;Masashi;Sam, despite your lack of{tgm}...{tgm} refinement,|I notice that it seems women aren't put off by you.|In fact, they seem to like you more for it.
s;Sam;I guess never paid attention or kept track.
s;Masashi;Do you get a lot of dates, then?
s;Sam;Not especially.|{c:e;Sam;Smile}Although, when I was with the Ebony Tigers, women liked to watch us guys train.|Naturally, we all tried to outdo each other whenever that happened.
s;Masashi;Maybe I should rethink my approach...;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Sam;Also, if we saved a village or such,|the women were definitely very grateful to have their men rescued,|resources and money returned, that kind of thing.
s;Masashi;That decides it, friend. From this day forward, Masashi is no more!
s;Sam;Huh? You can't just disappear from existence.
