s;Sam;Just because you don't wear a shirt doesn't mean you're more of a man all of a sudden.|{c:e;Sam;CloseEyes}*sigh*{w}{c:e;Sam;HalfCloseEyes} What did you have in mind that you wanted to do{tgm}...{tgm} Mansashi?
s;MasashiShirtless;What else do MEN do?|Go to the tavern and get drunk. And stare at hot women, preferably naked ones.
s;Sam;Just what happened to him?{c:e;Sam;HalfCloseEyes} I should supervise him.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;MasashiShirtless;Honey, I'm home! Where's the liquor?
s;Sam;Hey, we're both hungry and thirsty. Been a rough training day.|We might be a little out of sorts, so some food and drink would be greatly appreciated.
s;Man6;Girls, show these boys to a table.
s;BuffBarmaid;On it, boss. Right this way, boys.
s;MasashiShirtless;Hey, hottie.|I'd be interested in getting to know you more when you're off.
s;BuffBarmaid;Heh, heh I'll think about it, handsome.
s;Barmaid;Here you are, boys. Some food and drink.
s;Sam;Thanks, that's good looking stuff there.
s;MasashiShirtless;Oh heyyyy good lookin', you HAVE been cooking.
s;Barmaid;You're not that bad yourself, cutie.|{c:e;Barmaid;NormalBlink,Smile}You free later?
s;MasashiShirtless;I mean, y-yes!{c:e;MasashiShirtless;Smile} I{tgm}...{tgm} I sure am!
s;MasashiShirtless;This is working?|{c:e;MasashiShirtless;HalfCloseEyes}Dear Merin, why is this working??;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Sam;Have fun, Masashi. Be good to her.
s;MasashiShirtless;Why on earth did that work? That shouldn't have worked at all.;StyleNid=thought_bubble

name: SupportSamTaylor
_source: s;Sam;Huah! Rargh! Hoorah! You're dead now!
s;Taylor;Huh, his axe maneuvers are better than I would've expected|for one living in the wilds for so long.
s;Sam;Ah, Taylor! Didn't notice you there. You here to train too?
s;Taylor;I was, yeah. Your attacks are surprisingly accurate. Fast too.
s;Sam;I had a few good trainers.
s;Sam;He was one of them.|Though, I encountered a few mercenaries who taught me a few things too.
s;Taylor;That explains it.|{c:e;Taylor;Smile}So, what do you do when you're not training?
s;Sam;Uhh{tgm}...{tgm} Stare at Chell's thighs and ass?
s;Sam;Uhh{tgm}...{tgm} Stare at Krista's thighs and ass?
s;Sam;Wait, I said that out loud?
s;Taylor;Yup!|{c:e;Taylor;NoSmile}You know what, why don't we continue this conversation in a more relaxing atmosphere?
s;Taylor;Tavern here we come! Have your drinks ready!
s;Sam;Oh no! I don't think this is a good idea!

name: SupportSamYumi
_source: s;Yumi;Oh, hello big guy~|{c:e;Yumi;NormalBlink,Smile}You look handsome and strong.|{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Very strong. So very strong.
s;Sam;Laying it on kind of thick, aren't you?
s;Yumi;Usually, guys take one look at me and they're head over heels over me.
s;Sam;Why? You're pretty to look at, yeah.|But why do most guys go stupid when they see you?
s;Yumi;These? My boobies? My massive fu--
s;Sam;Wait, wait, wait, back up. What in the world are "boobies"?
s;Sam;I dunno, but did you see her arms? And those legs!|Oh, looks like she's going to the arena. Talk later!

s;Yumi;Huh, strange. He didn't ask me out or anything.|{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes}On top of that, how in the world does he NOT know what boobies are?|{c:e;Yumi;CloseEyes}BOOBIES!{c:e;Yumi;NormalBlink} For crying out loud, every red-blooded man knows what boobies are.|{tgm}{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes}...{tgm} Wait.
s;Yumi;He left me!{br}Oh no, you don't!|You're not getting away that easily, mister!
# Original script by Berserker Sam and PKLucky #

name: SupportSamReem
_source: s;Reem;Umm{tgm}...{tgm} thank you?|You really shouldn't just blurt things out like that. It's{tgm}...{tgm} improper.
s;Sam;Sorry. I've always admired wyvern riders, and you have a gorgeous complexion.
s;Reem;Thank you, but could we get away from my looks? Please?
s;Reem;It's not you, it's just{tgm}...{c:e;Reem;CloseEyes}{tgm} It's a personal matter.
s;Sam;Care to indulge me at all?
s;Reem;Forrest used to compliment me when he and Princess Krista would come to visit Fuegsol.
s;Sam;I didn't know you and he were close. I'm sorry.|I wasn't trying to cause any rifts.

s;Reem;We're not. At least, not anymore.|{c:e;Reem;CloseEyes}I think?|{c:e;Reem;HalfCloseEyes}It's{tgm}...{tgm} complicated.|{c:e;Reem;NormalBlink}I'm not sure where we stand, and he's not the easiest to reason with.|But, let's change subjects.|You said you admired wyvern riders. Why?
s;Sam;Ballads and stories made them out to be a terror to behold,|almost like they were beyond human.|And when I see you and Prince Khalid soar across the battlefield, it's spectacular!
s;Reem;I could take you for a ride sometime if you like.
s;Sam;Just not sure if I would like not being on the ground is all.
s;Sam;Hey, Reem! What are you up to?
s;Reem;Ah, Sam. A pleasure to see you.|You just caught me before I set off to do patrols around the castle perimeter.|Would you like to join me?
s;Reem;Here, you can take a seat behind me on the saddle.
s;Sam;W-Wait, you mean you're gonna fly around?
s;Reem;Of course. The air provides a better view of the area.|Not to mention it will be faster that way.|And Aina here can handle our combined weight just fine.
s;Reem;Besides, my offer of taking you for a ride is still on the table.|{c:e;Reem;NoSmile}Unless you don't want to?

s;Sam;Well, I never said that.|It's not that I don't like being above ground.|{tgm}{c:e;Sam;HalfCloseEyes}...{tgm} I think?{c:e;Sam;CloseEyes} I dunno.|{c:e;Sam;NormalBlink}I just want to be in charge of where my whole body's going, y'know?

s;Reem;Ah, I think I get it.|{c:e;Reem;NormalBlink,Smile}How about I teach you how to fly, then? Give you a hands-on lesson?|You'll be in control of the reins,|but I'll still be there to make sure we don't make any crash landings.
s;Reem;Alright, let's go! Here, I'll help you on.
s;Reem;Good. Keep yourself steady.|Hold onto the reins with both hands,|then gently squeeze your thighs to let Aina know you're ready to take off.
s;Reem;Just maintain your balance and you'll be fine.|{c:e;Reem;NoSmile}We're going to need to go up in altitude here.|Move both legs back and give your thighs a squeeze again.
s;Reem;There you go! You're doing well for your first time, Sam.

s;Reem;Alright, let's make a right turn here.|Move your left leg back a bit and gently squeeze your thighs to give Aina the signal.|Don't try to guide her too much with the reins. She'll understand what to do.
s;Reem;Okay, the perimeter looks good. Let's go ahead and land.|Move both feet forward and squeeze the thighs again.
s;Reem;I'm glad you think so.|I'd love to take you out on another ride some time.
s;Sam;That would be great! I'm looking forward to it.

name: SupportSamCeleste
_source: s;Celeste;Hoo-ya! Take that, meanie!|Now, stay down, stupid bandit! Ya!|{c:e;Celeste;CloseEyes,Smile}Celeste wins again!
s;Sam;Hey, kid! Training your axe skills again?
s;Celeste;Hey, mister! Yeah, I gotta get stronger!|Need to do my best and to keep my friends safe.
s;Sam;Good for you.|{c:e;Sam;Smile}You like axes, it seems.

s;Celeste;Yeah, axes are the best!|{c:e;Celeste;CloseEyes,NoSmile}Who wants a boring old sword anyway?|{c:e;Celeste;Smile,NormalBlink}I can chop wood with this if I need to!|When was the last time a swordfighter chopped up wood with a sword?
s;Sam;Yeah, axes are really cool.|{c:e;Sam;Smile,NormalBlink}They're also fun to swing through the air.
s;Celeste;I know, right?|{c:e;Celeste;Smile,CloseEyes}Whoosh, whoosh!{c:e;Celeste;Smile,NormalBlink} They're so cool!
s;Celeste;I tried to get Michael to use an axe, but he just sticks to his lance.
s;Celeste;I tried to get my friend Michael to use an axe, but he just sticks to his lance.
s;Celeste;I never really got the appeal.
s;Sam;The spear is a good weapon, though.|I don't use one myself, but yes, axes are great.|{c:e;Sam;NoSmile}What got you to use axes in the first place?
s;Celeste;My mom. This was her axe.
s;Celeste;She was the one who taught me and Michael how to use our respective weapons in the first place.
s;Celeste;She was the one who taught me how to use an axe in the first place.
s;Celeste;Yeah. That's why I'm going to be the best axe swinger around one day!|They'll sing songs about Celeste the Invincible!
s;Sam;I look forward to it. Keep improving, kiddo!
s;Celeste;Okay, you bandit, now where were we?

name: SupportForrestLucy
_source: s;Forrest;Hello, Lucy. I see you and Bessie are doing well.
s;Lucy;Yup! Looks like you and Macintosh are doing good too.
s;Forrest;How are you holding up after your first taste of combat?
s;Lucy;Doing okay.|{c:e;Lucy;NoSmile}A lot of people got hurt, though.

s;Forrest;That's war, Lucy. People are going to get hurt.|That's why it's imperative that there's always at least one medic on hand. Preferably more.|And with you able to dash around on your horse,|you can get to people that those on foot cannot.
s;Lucy;I know, Sir Forrest.|{c:e;Lucy;Smile}I like making people feel better, patching up their boo-boos and all that.
s;Forrest;Medea, please tell me this is NOT how she explains the healing craft to people.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Lucy;I just wish I could help Mom get better though. She was--{c:e;Lucy;NormalBlink}Is the best.
s;Forrest;She is. We're lucky she taught you what she knew before her illness came.
s;Lucy;I just wish I could help her.
s;Forrest;You are. Knowing you're helping in her place is helping her, Lucy.|She doesn't have to worry that no one is tending to those getting hurt.
s;Lucy;Okay! I'll do my best and become the best healer ever! Other than Mom, of course.
s;Lucy;I'm gonna go practice my healing magic! See you later, Sir Forrest!
s;Forrest;I hope for her sake her mother does recover,|but this illness that has afflicted her is a strange one.|No one seems to know what it is.

name: SupportForrestXiang
_source: s;Forrest;Ah, Xiang. I did not see you there. Did you need something?
s;Xiang;Forrest, how apt would you say you are at casting magic?
s;Forrest;Hmm, not very.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I've only dabbled in basic spellcasting.|And it's not something I've ever considered putting a lot of focus into.
s;Xiang;Then, that means you've never explored your options outside of the natural magicks?
s;Xiang;I see. Would you like to expand your knowledge?
s;Forrest;Elder magic? You mean the dark arts?
s;Xiang;That's a rather derogatory way to refer to it.{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink} But, yes.
s;Forrest;Ah, I apologize.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}But either way, that's surprising.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}Why Da--I mean, Elder magic specifically?|An innate talent for it is rare.
s;Xiang;You have the potential for it, Forrest. I can sense it.
s;Forrest;Are you sure you're not mistaken, Xiang?
s;Xiang;I'm positive.|In fact, your potential for it has me curious about you.|I wish to see how far you can go with this.
s;Forrest;Well, I have to admit, now I'm curious about that as well.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I'll let you know when I have a moment to practice it with you, then.

name: SupportSamMichael
_source: s;Michael;Okay, Michael. Steady. Keep a good grip and thrust.
s;Michael;Oh, it's you, sir. Yes, sir, that's me.
s;Sam;You don't need to "sir" me. Just call me Sam.
s;Sam;I was watching your lance work, and while I'm no expert, your form seems good.|It's a nice, accurate reach weapon.
s;Michael;Yes, s{tgm}...{tgm} Mister Sam.{c:e;Michael;Smile} Thank you.
s;Sam;No problem!|{c:e;Sam;NoSmile}Would you like to train? I can show you a few things that I've learned.|Some things to watch out for particularly when facing an axe fighter.
s;Michael;I'd like that, Mister Sam. It would help.
s;Sam;Great!|Though, your armor looks pretty defensive,|so there's not as much of a worry when it comes to getting injured.|Still, knowing is half the battle.
s;Michael;Wow, this guy is a lot friendlier than he looks!|He looks like a lawless brigand but he's kind of jolly.|Like Santa Claus' nephew or something.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Sam;C'mon, Michael, show me what you can do!
s;Sam;You're pretty good for your age, Michael.|However, unlike a sword or a spear where you can easily recover from a miss,|an axe is a momentum weapon.
s;Sam;If you miss a lance strike, you can retract it quickly.|An axe, however, once you set it in motion, you have to follow through.
s;Michael;So, if I can see the path it's on,|I can then tell where it will go next?
s;Sam;Right on! You're doing good, kid.|I'll see you around.

name: SupportKaiYumi
_source: s;Kai;It's impolite to stare, you know.
s;Yumi;My, aren't you sharp? It makes me wonder if you're used to getting stared at.
s;Yumi;Does the nickname "The Escort Mercenary" mean anything to you?
s;Kai;Can't say it does. Should it?

s;Yumi;I've heard that a handsome young mercenary from Merinas|has been selling more than just his sword arm.|{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}If you catch my drift.|{c:e;Yumi;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Ring any bells?
s;Kai;Well, I can admit my "swordplay" is decent.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,Smile}And I have shown it off to those willing to pay me.|Though, I'd imagine not as often as these rumors say.
s;Yumi;So, you're saying it HAS happened.
s;Kai;Since you seem so interested in my services, let me lay out my terms.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Payment consists of both gold and information.|If the info's not good enough, it's a no-go.
s;Yumi;Oh, it's good. Trust me. Working for the arena's got its perks.
s;Kai;In that case, how about we talk business over some drinks?|Let's see how good that info of yours really is.
s;Yumi;Kai, do you mind if I ask you something?
s;Yumi;Wha--Hey! You can't just run off like that!
s;Kai;Aren't you persistent?|{c:e;Kai;NoSmile}Good job tailing me, but I'm still not gonna talk about that.

s;Kai;You gave me your payment and I delivered. Transaction's over.|I make it a policy to not dwell on nights like that after the fact.|It's best if you did the same, Yumi. I wouldn't want you to get attached.
s;Yumi;Get attached? Just what kind of girl do you take me for?!
s;Kai;I've seen this sort of thing happen before, Yumi.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}We start talking more, you pay for more one-on-one time,|one thing leads to another--
s;Yumi;Don't be so full of yourself!{c:e;Yumi;NormalBlink} You weren't even that great.
s;Yumi;Oh, good. You're actually listening to me.|{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes}Your performance was mediocre, Kai.
s;Yumi;It was such a drag! Where was the energy? The passion?|{c:e;Yumi;CloseEyes}Honestly, I feel bad for anyone who paid for such a poor display.
s;Kai;Well, my past clients were satisfied enough, so why should I care?
s;Yumi;Do you even hear yourself right now?!|What about any future clients? You need to step it up for their sake.|Be glad I'm not asking for a refund.
s;Kai;Wow, harsh words, Yumi. Harsh words.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,NoSmile}But, again, the transaction's done. End of discussion.
s;Yumi;Oh no, it's not. I am getting my money's worth out of you whether you like it or not.
s;Kai;Your money's worth?|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}Oh, dear Merin, you're not suggesting{tgm}...
s;Yumi;My quarters. I'll let you know when I'm free.
s;Yumi;I'm sure Her Highness would LOVE to know|what her loyal retainer has been doing in his free time.
s;YumiShirtless;That wasn't any better than last time.
s;KaiShirtless;And I keep telling you I don't care.|{c:e;KaiShirtless;NormalBlink}Whatever you're looking for, you're not gonna find it with me, Yumi.
s;YumiShirtless;Why bother with this line of work then?
s;KaiShirtless;Because there's a demand. It's all a means to an end.
s;YumiShirtless;Come on, you can't honestly believe that.|Hasn't there been at least one client who you maybe{tgm}...|{c:e;YumiShirtless;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm}Wanted as more than just a client?
s;KaiShirtless;Nope. It's just a job to me.
s;YumiShirtless;Do you just not like doing it?
s;KaiShirtless;I didn't say that. I just don't feel one way or another about it, is all.

s;KaiShirtless;I know most people say they actually get excitement out of it, but not me.|{c:e;KaiShirtless;NormalBlink}Like I said before, as long as we both get what we want out of it,|I don't care how they feel.|At the end of the day, it's a transaction.
s;YumiShirtless;You know, if you said all that to begin with, I wouldn't have pestered you about it.
s;KaiShirtless;It's what I was trying to say from the start.
s;YumiShirtless;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} I suppose so.|{c:e;YumiShirtless;NormalBlink}Sorry for wasting your time, Kai.

s;KaiShirtless;Hey, that's my line.|{c:e;KaiShirtless;NoSmile}I'll refund you the gold, Yumi.|You said you'd want your money's worth, and you're not gonna get it.|So, it'd be in your best interest to take it back.
s;YumiShirtless;Keep it.{c:e;Yumi;HalfCloseEyes,Smile} Think of it as compensation for me being a bother.
s;KaiShirtless;Suit yourself.|{c:e;KaiShirtless;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Anyway, I'd better get dressed and out the door.|Better to slip out while it's still dark, after all.
s;KaiShirtless;Hey. Before I go, I just wanna say thanks.

name: SupportTrevorXiang
_source: s;Trevor;Ah, Miss Xiang! May I have a moment of your time?
s;Trevor;You seem quite adept at using Dark magic--

s;Trevor;Now this is exactly why I am in need of your assistance!{w}{c:e;Trevor;NoSmile} You see,|I wish to delve deeper into understanding the inner workings of various types of magic.|Under normal circumstances, I would ask Felicity to help in this endeavor.|{c:e;Trevor;CloseEyes}However, she seems more interested in being an overall nuisance|rather than a fellow arcane scholar.
s;Trevor;Miss Xiang, could you please teach me everything you know about Da--|I mean, Elder magic?|{c:e;Trevor;Smile}In return, I could teach you anything you may desire about Anima magic.
s;Trevor;Wha--Oh!{c:e;Trevor;CloseEyes,Smile} Fascinating.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink,Smile}It seems I have much to learn!
s;Trevor;Miss Xiang, is there a reason why you use these{tgm}...|{tgm}archaic terms for the schools of magic?
s;Xiang;Those terms are what they are supposed to be called.|It wasn't until recently that the names have changed.
s;Trevor;Recently? Why, as far as I am aware,|Dark and Anima have been called these names for centuries!
s;Xiang;{tgm}...{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm} Right.{w}{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes} My sense of time has been lost on me.

s;Trevor;I apologize. I did not mean to imply that you were at fault in any way.|Honestly, it is intriguing how language evolves over time.|However, having "Elder magic" become "Dark magic" seems rather insidious.
s;Trevor;It being called Elder magic seems more appropriate.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}The name implies it to be the oldest type of magic.
s;Trevor;Since that is the case,|Elder magic should be taught to set a foundation for the other schools of magic.
s;Xiang;Elder magic is different from Light and Nature magic.|Even if you had the ability to cast either one of those,|it does not automatically mean you can also cast Elder magic.
s;Trevor;So it involves a deeper innate potential{tgm}...|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}{tgm} I suppose that explains why practitioners of Elder magic are few and far between.
s;Xiang;That is{tgm}...{tgm} part of the reason.
s;Xiang;Do you know of the original practitioners of Elder magic, Trevor?
s;Trevor;Why, yes! They were the Shifters, were they not?
s;Xiang;Correct.|And what about Light magic? What was its origin?
s;Trevor;It came from Medea himself.|He had blessed the Sacred Five with this power that we now know as Light magic.
s;Xiang;Also correct. I'm sure from here,|you can draw some conclusions as to why Elder magic is not as widespread?
s;Trevor;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Yes, I see.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}The War of Divides, wasn't it?
s;Xiang;And another correct answer.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}We can continue this discussion at another time, Trevor.|It seems our time for lessons is almost up.
s;Trevor;Quite alright. Until next time, Miss Xiang.

name: SupportForrestKai
_source: s;Kai;Sure was. That puts our monthly spars at a tie again with four wins each.
s;Forrest;Seems so. Though we're evenly matched, your speed always impresses me.|It feels as if you can get another attack in before I can do anything.
s;Kai;Thanks, but it's not like you make it any easier for me.|Your defensive maneuvers always keep me on my toes.
s;Forrest;Perhaps one day we'll see who's the better one between us.
s;Kai;I believe we already established that around eight months ago.
s;Forrest;That was a fluke and you know it.
s;Kai;Aw, don't be like that. Look at it this way.|If I didn't win, you would've lost out on the best sparring partner in the world.
s;Kai;Come on. You like having me around. Admit it.
s;Forrest;Before this conversation, I would have agreed.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}But I suppose training alongside you has had its benefits.

s;Forrest;If I knew you were this insufferable, I would have never agreed to hiring you.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}Still, your knowledge has proved useful time and time again.|You have been a great addition to our ranks thus far.
s;Forrest;At any rate, I will be preparing for our next spar.|{c:e;Forrest;Smile}Don't expect me to go easy on you.
s;Kai;I never do, Forrest. I never do.
s;Kai;Hey, I've been wondering something.|What reasons do you have for training as much as you do?|Aside from the obvious, of course.
s;Forrest;I'm afraid the obvious reason is my only reason, Kai.|Protecting Her Highness is my duty, and I take this duty seriously.|I'd even lay down my life if it meant ensuring her safety.
s;Kai;You sure have a one-track mind.|Is that why you were so dead-set on beating me during our first spar?

s;Kai;It checks out if that were the case. We did agree that if I won, I'd be hired, after all.|Were you so opposed to have anyone get close to Her Highness|that you'd do whatever it took to keep her out of reach?
s;Kai;You're so easy to read.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,Smile}With how much you wear your heart on your sleeve,|I'm surprised Her Highness hasn't figured out that you--
s;Forrest;We are ending the conversation here!
s;Forrest;Have I mentioned how insufferable you can be?

s;Kai;In all seriousness, your devotion is almost enviable, Forrest.|Can't say I'm of the same mentality, though.|I value my own existence much more than anyone else's.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}If I realized that sooner, then maybe things could've been different{tgm}...
s;Forrest;What do you mean by that?
s;Kai;Ah, it's nothing. Just me thinking aloud.
s;Kai;Anyway, good spar again, Forrest.|Keep up the good work.
s;Kai;Forrest, I've been wondering this for a while now,|but about Prince Ervan{tgm}...
s;Forrest;I don't like where this is going.
s;Kai;I haven't even said anything yet.
s;Kai;How did you feel about him?|Considering how protective you are of Her Highness, assumptions can be made.
s;Forrest;Draw your sword, Kai. We're due for our monthly spar.
s;Forrest;We're due for our monthly spar, you know.|Perhaps I'll give you an answer if you best me.
s;Kai;Who's being the insufferable one now?|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes,Smile}But sure, I'll bite.
s;Kai;I win, you spill. You win, you keep your mouth shut?
s;Kai;I'll definitely win, then. I'll make sure of it.
s;Kai;*huff huff* That's{tgm}...{tgm} *huff* my win{tgm}...{tgm} Whew{tgm}...
s;Kai;Seriously, Forrest, that was the hardest I've ever seen you fight.|You don't even get like that in an actual battle.
s;Forrest;I apologize. I don't know what came over me.
s;Kai;You're lucky I like you.|I never would've followed through on this otherwise.
s;Forrest;If you absolutely must know, I harbored no ill feelings towards His Highness.
s;Forrest;It's just{tgm}...{tgm} I felt envious of him. That's all.
s;Kai;Figured as much.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,NoSmile}Why be so defensive about it, though?
s;Forrest;Knowing you, you'd accuse me of arranging the prince's death.
s;Kai;Just for that? Forrest, you think so low of me.|{c:e;Kai;HalfCloseEyes,NoSmile}I suspected you from the start.
s;Kai;Granted, I've been suspicious of both you and Her Highness.|But now, let's just say you're off my list of possible suspects.
s;Kai;What's with that face? I figured you'd be happy about that.
s;Kai;Admittedly, there have been rumors going around.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}I can't exactly discount them. Not when they could be a feasible lead.
s;Kai;You're always so on edge when it comes to her.|I wouldn't worry about it, especially if she's innocent.
s;Kai;Do you doubt her, Forrest?|Or is there something else weighing down on you?
s;Forrest;{tgm}...{tgm}{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes} I've held up my end of the bargain, Kai.|I do not need to indulge your curiosity any longer.
s;Kai;Forrest{tgm}...{tgm} Just what do you know?

s;Forrest;That does not mean I would consider laying a hand on him.|Nor would I find joy in any misfortune befalling him.|{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}When Her Highness informed me of what happened,|I was more shocked than anything.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}She loved him, Kai.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}I can't even begin to think what went wrong that day.
s;Kai;So, that's how it is{tgm}...{tgm}{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink} You had absolutely nothing to do with it after all.
s;Forrest;I suppose that would be the logical thing to do.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}With all this in mind, Kai, what will you do now?
s;Kai;I'll keep doing what I've been doing.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}Regrettably, there's still questions that need answers.|I'll be sticking around until I find them.
s;Forrest;Is that all you wish to say?
s;Kai;It's just{tgm}...{tgm} if you weren't there, things would have been a lot worse.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}So, thanks.
s;Forrest;I have no need for your gratitude.
s;Kai;I know. I still wanted to say something.

s;Kai;I still think your feelings about Her Highness are completely self-destructive.|However, if you didn't act when you did, we may have lost her.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}And if we did, it would have been my fault.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}I thought about what you said back then. That guilt would have been too much to bear.|{c:e;Kai;HalfCloseEyes}Perhaps I was wrong when I left{br}Lady Tsubaki too.

s;Forrest;No, I believe you had every right to call me out. All I've known is protecting Her Highness.|This duty clouded my mind to the point where I forgot I had my own life to live.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}When I rescued Princess Krista from Circ's Talons, luck was on my side.|{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}If I hesitated for even a moment{tgm}...

s;Kai;But you didn't. And that's what matters.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}Your determination, your discipline{tgm}...|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink}{tgm}When you factor Princess Krista out, it's quite admirable.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes}Really admirable.{w}{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink} You're not a bad guy, Forrest.
s;Forrest;Was that a genuine compliment from you just now?
s;Kai;Believe what you want to believe.|{c:e;Kai;NormalBlink,Smile}Anyway, that's where we're ending things off. See ya.
s;Forrest;Hah, even now, laying your heart bare is like pulling teeth.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink,Smile}But that's just how you are, isn't it?
s;Forrest;Kai, there is nothing to be ashamed about.
s;Kai;I said all those horrible things to you, though.|Why would you even care about how I feel about you?
s;Forrest;Because you're my friend, Kai.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}No, you're more than that.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink,Smile}You're an irreplaceable companion.
s;Kai;Laying on a bit thick, aren't we?
s;Forrest;That is just exactly how I feel.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes,NoSmile}When you stayed behind, I felt betrayed.|{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}I thought that despite everything, you'd still{tgm}...
s;Kai;Krista did kill Ervan.|What would you expect me to think of my employer after learning something like that?
s;Forrest;Yes, you're right.{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes} I was foolish to think you'd do anything else.
s;Kai;But, y'know, I am glad you think so highly of me.|{c:e;Kai;CloseEyes,Smile}I've burned so many bridges that someone liking me would be a rarity.
s;Forrest;Like I said, you're irreplaceable to me, Kai.{c:e;Forrest;Smile} It won't be easy for me to think ill of you.

name: SupportForrestMarina
_source: s;Forrest;♫ Hm-hmm hmmmm~ Lala la doo doo{tgm}...{tgm} ♫
s;Marina;Oh, Sir Forrest. Was that you just now?
s;Forrest;Miss Marina! You startled me.|And I'm sorry, but what are you referring to?
s;Forrest;My singing? I'm not being a nuisance, am I?
s;Marina;The complete opposite, actually! You have quite the voice, Sir Forrest.|If you weren't a knight, I'm sure you would make an excellent bard.
s;Forrest;Thank you? I'm not sure how to take that.

s;Marina;Take it as a compliment, dear.|{c:e;Marina;NoSmile}Trust me, if this knight business goes south, you have nothing to worry about.|You have your charming voice to fall back on.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Though, even if you didn't have the gift of song,|your handsome face could get you far in other lines of work.
s;Marina;Pay no mind to that last thing. It was merely a joke.|I'll let you get back to your chores.
s;Forrest;Just what did she mean by other lines of{tgm}...?
s;Forrest;D-Did she really mean--?!|No, of course not. Why would she insinuate{tgm}...|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}{tgm}For the love of Medea, I spend too much time with Krista.
s;Marina;♫ Lyuk mistyek mire treux di rosbanl ye felk~ ♫;FontType=iconvo
s;Marina;Sir Forrest?|{c:e;Marina;Smile}Haha! I see it's your turn to walk in on me this time.
s;Forrest;I apologize. I did not mean to disturb you.
s;Marina;Oh, Sir Forrest, you can be so serious sometimes.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}No harm done. Really.
s;Marina;Why don't you stay here and relax for a little while?|You must be busy, but a few minutes of rest won't hurt, I'm sure.
s;Forrest;It would be rude if I declined, wouldn't it?|I shall take you up on your offer, then.
s;Forrest;May I ask you something, Miss Marina?
s;Forrest;What was that song you were singing just now?|It was quite beautiful.
s;Marina;Ah, it's a folk song that originated from Lake Lunaris.|It's called "Moon Forest".
s;Marina;Indeed.|Its lyrics speak of the moon's beauty as it's reflected upon Lake Lunaris's surface.|I could teach it to you, if you'd like.
s;Marina;Absolutely. I wasn't lying the other day when I said you had a good voice.|Honestly, I just want to hear you at least attempt to sing it.
s;Forrest;Well, if you insist.|{c:e;Forrest;Smile}I'll do my best, Miss Marina.
s;;Note: This Support is best enjoyed with BGM <red>on</>!;;140;hint;NumLines=2;no_sound
s;;♫ Lyuk mistyek mire treux di rosbanl ye felk ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Lechur nil foi glaum tunarg fhuear ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Seo timlal dyuh fain calel cilmeirg otach ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Ainn mel dom duit glaum widlys ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Baramok ha chirt feur sao cran purg lefild ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Tarugxa verhol zwher bewo phard juinak ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Beto karf efors creat shero whoss harg{br}orvig ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;;♫ Sirdeph anirm vlart xer harg ♫;bottom;FontType=iconvo;no_block;hold;no_sound;fit
s;Marina;That was very good, Sir Forrest.|I'm very proud of your progress.
s;Forrest;Thank you, Miss Marina.|Though, I believe you deserve most of the credit.|It was only because of your guidance that I was able to sing that song.
s;Marina;Oh, you flatter me too much.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}But, thank you. I really do appreciate it.
s;Forrest;Now that I think of it,|it's been a while since I've heard you sing the whole song by yourself.|Would it be a bother if{tgm}...
s;Marina;Of course I can sing it for you, Sir Forrest.|You don't need to be so shy about a simple favor.
s;Forrest;(Miss Marina... Her voice has always been so melodic.)|(But for some reason in this moment...)|(Everything about her is...);bottom;fit
s;Marina;You know, Sir Forrest, I wouldn't mind teaching you more Folian ballads.|That is, if you are willing to learn.
s;Forrest;I would love to, Miss Marina.|I may even teach you some Medean tunes as well.|I do happen to know a few.
s;Marina;♫ Laleru naki sereru baki ♫|♫ So' mune rame so'me ♫
s;Marina;Thank you, Sir Forrest. It's a beautiful lullaby.
s;Forrest;Indeed. My mother would sing it to me every night when I was younger.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes,Smile}It's a good memory.
s;Marina;I'm sure.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Though it's hard to imagine you as a little boy sleeping to lullabies|when you're such a mature young man now.
s;Forrest;This young man had to start somewhere.

s;Marina;Very true.{w}{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile} You know, when I myself was a little girl,|I dreamed of getting swept off my feet by a dashing young knight.|I never thought that would have actually happened to me.
s;Marina;Yes, I do, Sir Forrest.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}You have certainly won the heart of this fair maiden.

s;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} I see.{c:wait;200}{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes} Ahem.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}If we're being candid here,{c:e;Forrest;Smile} then I must admit this knight's heart has been won over as well.|{c:e;Forrest;NoSmile}I will say that describing me as "dashing" is a bit much, though.
s;Marina;I wouldn't say so. I've already told you how handsome you are.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}And with a face like that, it makes me wonder if there's a body to match.
s;Marina;You always looked so gallant and strong when riding across the battlefield.|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Just what could be beneath all that armor, hm?
s;Marina;Come now, there's no need to be so formal anymore, Forrest.
s;Forrest;Still, this, er, doesn't seem like a proper conversation to have.
s;Marina;We've had worse.{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile} Remember how I said you could do other lines of work?
s;Marina;I do still think that.{w}{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile} In fact, I wouldn't mind if we did it for free.

s;Forrest;Wh-What?! I{tgm}...{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}{tgm} Erm{tgm}...{tgm} W-Well--|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I apologize, Marina.|I-I just remembered Her Highness needed me for{tgm}...{tgm} Um{tgm}...|{tgm}S-Sorry, goodbye!
s;Marina;Still a little boy in that regard, I see. How cute.|{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile}He'll come around eventually, I'm sure.

name: SupportForrestAlex
_source: s;Alex;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Perhaps if I hold it like this? Then do this?|{c:e;Alex;HalfCloseEyes}No, that doesn't seem right either{tgm}...|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink}{tgm}I'm sorry for putting you through this, Tia.|{c:e;Alex;Smile}Once we get it done, I'll let you have an extra helping of oats.
s;Alex;Ah, General Forrest! Perfect timing.|Do you have a moment?
s;Forrest;I do. Did you need something?

s;Alex;Yes. You see, back when your father led the royal army,|he taught the Lance Cavalry unit a certain technique.|I was just barely a squire back then, but I wanted to learn it myself when the time came.

s;Alex;I have been looking over this combat manual he wrote,|but I'm not sure if I'm performing the actions detailed in it correctly.|Do you mind looking it over while you observe my and Tia's movements?|I could really use an outside perspective.

s;Forrest;You have the right idea, but there's still room for improvement.|Point the tip of your lance a little lower from where you intend to strike.|That will give you a better view of your target|and it will prevent you from lowering your weapon further when you do strike.
s;Alex;Understood. I'll give it another try.
s;Forrest;There you go. I'm already seeing improvement.

s;Alex;Thank you, General. I think I can handle practicing more on my own from here.|{c:e;Alex;NoSmile}However, there are more maneuvers in this manual I'm interested in learning.|Is it alright if I call upon you again if I need more assistance?
s;Alex;General, may I ask you something?
s;Alex;I've noticed that you've been more focused on your swordplay|than your lance techniques lately.|Is there any particular reason for that?
s;Forrest;While I have maintained my lance skills in my free time,|I feel compelled to improve my swordsmanship more.|Maybe even have it surpass my lance prowess.
s;Forrest;Yes, Alex? Is there something you wish to say?
s;Alex;No, nothing at all, General.|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink,Smile}I'm just amused that someone as stoic as you can experience jealousy.
s;Alex;It's no coincidence that you have focused on improving your sword skills eight months ago.|{c:e;Alex;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}You know, the time when Her Highness acquired a new sword tutor?
s;Forrest;Alex, you are very much overstepping your boundaries here.
s;Alex;I see no problem with what I've said, General.|{c:e;Alex;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Is there one?
s;Forrest;Anyway, I have{tgm}...{tgm} important matters to attend to.|If you'll excuse me{tgm}...
s;Alex;Oh, Forrest, you're never subtle when it comes to her.
s;Forrest;Excellent work, Alex.|You have made great strides with going through my father's combat manual.
s;Alex;Thank you, General.|It's thanks to you that I have been able to do so.|Now there's just one last technique to go over.
s;Forrest;Alright. I'm ready whenever you are.
s;Alex;So, General, what did you think?
s;Forrest;Overall, very good. However, if I may{tgm}...
s;Forrest;If you slide your hand down lower on the shaft like this{tgm}...
s;Forrest;You'll find that it's a more balanced grip.|It won't be as much of a burden if you lower yourself down to this position.
s;Forrest;There's no need to hold it as tightly as you did before.|With less stress on your hand, you have more energy to focus on other things.
s;Forrest;I apologize, Alex. I didn't mean to--
s;Alex;No, it's alright!|It just surprised me how willing you were to take on a more{tgm}...{tgm} hands-on approach.|{c:e;Alex;CloseEyes}On top of that, you{tgm}...
s;Alex;Just be more mindful of your words next time.|Especially when you're that close.
s;Alex;Thank you for all your help, General Forrest.|If you don't mind, I think I'll call it here for today.
s;Forrest;You're welcome, Alex. Have a good rest of your day.|{c:e;Forrest;NoSmile}And please get some rest. You look feverish.
s;Alex;Ah, I-I'm fine. Thank you for your concern.|{c:e;Alex;NormalBlink}Anyway, I'll be taking my leave. Until next time, General.

s;Forrest;I hope she's feeling well.|She's been working hard, but I don't want her to overdo it.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}And what did she mean about watching my words? Just what did I say earlier?|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I don't think I said anything offensive, or{tgm}...
s;Forrest;Alright, hold it like this then thrust{tgm}...
s;Forrest;Yes, there we go.|Just a couple more like that, and I think I've got it.
s;Alex;Getting back into your lance training, General?
s;Forrest;A-Alex, you startled me. But, yes, I am.
s;Alex;Finally decided to give swords a rest?

s;Forrest;Not necessarily. My swordplay has just been maintained well enough right now.|I may do it more regularly again in the future,|but I know for a fact I need to get back into lances.|{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}I've found that I'm more rusty than I thought I was.
s;Alex;I see.{c:e;Alex;CloseEyes,Smile} Starting to move on, then.
s;Alex;It's nothing.|{c:e;Alex;NoSmile}Oh, General, doesn't that grip feel uncomfortable?|Wouldn't pulling your front hand back a bit feel less strenuous on your joints?
s;Forrest;Ah, I thought something felt off.{c:e;Forrest;Smile} Thank you, Alex.|Though I must say, shouldn't I be the one guiding you?
s;Alex;Heehee, I suppose so.|{c:e;Alex;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Besides, I'm sure that you would know how to handle your own lance better than I would.
s;Forrest;That should go without saying--|{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}Alex, what was with that tone just now?
s;Alex;I have no idea what you're talking about.
s;Forrest;Oh, really?{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes,Smile} Not insinuating something, are you?
s;Alex;I was just thinking that perhaps once you are done here,|I could observe your "lance techniques" up close?
s;Forrest;How forward. What's gotten you so confident?
s;Forrest;I don't mind it at all.|Though I feel that we should go out to dinner first, at least.

name: SupportForrestTorgen
_source: s;Forrest;Torgen, do you have a moment?
s;Forrest;I never had the opportunity to ask about this until now, but{tgm}...
s;Torgen;Uh-huh? Come on, spit it out.
s;Forrest;Or rather{tgm}...{tgm} How do I phrase this{tgm}...?
s;Torgen;You wanna know why getting tied up turns her on.
s;Forrest;I would have preferred a more subtle way of saying that, but yes.
s;Torgen;See, I'm not one-hundred percent sure why she does, but I do have my theories.
s;Torgen;Could be just that she likes it, no two ways about it.
s;Torgen;Who knows?|Maybe getting kidnapped all those years ago made her discover something about herself.
s;Torgen;I am! Not saying it could be the only reason.|There's also the chance the experience had the complete opposite effect.|She might've been traumatized so bad that this is her way of coping.
s;Forrest;That is disturbing and I hope that is not the case.
s;Torgen;Hey, like I said, I'm just theorizing.|Why don't you just ask her yourself if you're so curious?
s;Forrest;I'd rather not. It's a{tgm}...{tgm} strange subject to talk about.
s;Torgen;Hey, I think I have an idea.
s;Torgen;Why don't I try tying YOU up?
s;Torgen;Maybe you'll understand her point of view once you get a feel for yourself.
s;Forrest;An{tgm}...{tgm} interesting proposition. I'll consider it.
s;Torgen;I'll give you time to think about it. Lemme know if you're down to do this.
s;Forrest;I can't believe I agreed to this.
s;Torgen;We can still call it quits before we even start.
s;Forrest;No. I need to know why Her Highness finds this so appealing.
s;Torgen;Alright then. Take off your armor.
s;Torgen;What, do you WANT to have all that on when you're restrained?
# Forrest takes off his armor (Make new talk sprite)
s;Torgen;Now, turn around and hands behind your back.
s;Forrest;But I still wish to deepen my understanding.|Restrain me more. Maybe only tying the upper body isn't enough for me.
s;Torgen;Whatever you say.|Here, let's sit you down in that chair there. I'll tie your legs together.
s;Torgen;Well, there's one last thing I could do,|but I'm gonna need your permission for it.
s;Torgen;I'll blindfold you and touch different parts of your body without warning.|I won't go for anything between the legs even if you agree to this.|I'll guarantee that.
s;Torgen;I mean, unless you want me to.
s;Forrest;That aside, what would be the point of this?
s;Torgen;Taking away one of your senses will make you feel all helpless.|Maybe that's what Krista really likes about this.
s;Forrest;But I'm willing to try anything now. You may blindfold me, Torgen.
s;Torgen;Now, I'd usually gag Krista at this point too,|but that defeats the purpose of getting feedback from you.|So, just lemme know if you notice anything, alright?;bottom;fit
s;Forrest;(He's not doing anything. He wouldn't just leave me like this, would he?)|(No, of course not. But what if--);bottom;fit
s;Torgen;You were starting to squirm a bit.;bottom;fit
s;Torgen;I think we're starting to get somewhere, though.;bottom;fit
s;Forrest;(Okay. Focus.)|(There has to be a reason why Krista likes this.)|(If I can understand that, then maybe--);bottom;fit
s;Torgen;Well, that sure was a noise.;bottom;fit
s;Forrest;(My voice just came out on its own!)|(It was such an indecent sound too.)|(What... What is coming over me?);bottom;fit
s;Forrest;I need to be alone with my thoughts.
s;Torgen;And don't worry. I won't tell anyone about this.
s;Forrest;Did I feel helpless just now{tgm}...?
s;Forrest;No, not exactly. It was something else I felt.
s;Forrest;And I{tgm}...{tgm} didn't hate it, per se.

name: SupportForrestMichael
_source: s;Forrest;Excellent lance work, Michael. Very impressive.
s;Michael;Oh, Sir Forrest! Th-Thank you very much.|How long were you standing there for?
s;Forrest;Not for too long. However, I can see that your technique is serviceable.|This is due to your training with Foliaga's Holy Knights, I assume?
s;Forrest;It's a huge decision to become a knight in the first place.|What drove you to pursue this?
s;Michael;The stories, sir.|Knights always helped and protected the needy and downtrodden.|It made me want to do my part.
s;Forrest;Commendable. I had no such lofty aspirations, myself.|I simply followed my father's footsteps.|{c:e;Forrest;NoSmile}Although, Michael, I must ask.|Are you prepared to die as a knight?
s;Forrest;We are knights, Michael. We protect the realm and our liege with no hesitation.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}However, we are expendable.
s;Forrest;So, I ask again.|Are you willing to die in the name of your country, Michael?
s;Michael;I{tgm}...{tgm} I had not considered that, sir.|{c:e;Michael;NormalBlink}In the stories, the knights never died.|They slay dragons and rescue villagers with no trouble at all.
s;Forrest;This isn't a story Michael. Real life does not fall into such ideals.
s;Michael;I know, sir. It's just the prospect hadn't settled in.|I guess with comrades and other knights,|I thought I would be able to return home again.
s;Forrest;I advise that you put more thought into the decision you have made, Michael.|You must be sure you are prepared for the road ahead.

name: SupportKristaFelicity
_source: s;Krista;Sorry I'm late, Felicity. I had way more stuff to do today than I thought.|{c:e;Krista;Smile}Anyway, ready to do the shopping together?
s;Felicity;No need, Your Highness. I had finished the shopping this morning on my own.

s;Krista;Oh! You've been doing that a lot lately, huh?|{c:e;Krista;Smile,CloseEyes}Not that I mind, of course.|{c:e;Krista;Smile,NormalBlink}It's good to see you getting more used to dealing with crowds.
s;Felicity;Actually, I arrived at the marketplace early enough when it was mostly quiet.
s;Krista;Oh, really?|{c:e;Krista;Smile}Still, thanks for all your help, Felicity. Just don't push yourself too hard, okay?|I know that dealing with people can be tough sometimes.
s;Felicity;It's{tgm}...{tgm} It's nothing.|{c:e;Felicity;NormalBlink}At any rate, I have more chores to attend to. If you'll excuse me{tgm}...
s;Krista;I wonder what that was about.
s;Maid1;Say, did you hear?|Apparently some of Her Highness' garments had gone missing during the last laundry day.|{e;Maid1;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Guess who was on duty?
s;Maid2;*Gasp!* No way! It was Felicity, wasn't it?
s;Maid1;Mmhmm. Trisha told me all about it.|{c:e;Maid1;HalfCloseEyes,NoSmile}Once a thief, always a thief, I tell you.|Her Highness should just toss her back out to the streets where she belongs--
s;Maid2;Y-Your Highness! Was there something you needed?
s;Krista;Oh, nothing in particular.|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}But, Glenda, aren't you supposed to be scrubbing the floors in the west wing?
s;Krista;And Helen, aren't you supposed to be dusting in the main hall?
s;Maid2;We'll be on our way now.
s;Krista;Before you leave, one more thing.

s;Krista;Please remind the other maids during THAT time of the month|to treat the heavily soiled clothes properly and don't mix them in with the normal loads.|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Felicity has done such a good job with that, so you don't need to tell her.|{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes,Smile}In fact, let her know I EXPLICITLY said she's been doing a great job.
s;Maid2;{tgm}...{tgm} Y-Yes, Your Highness.|{c:e;Maid2;NormalBlink}Now, if you'll please excuse us{tgm}...
s;Krista;*sigh* Some people{tgm}...|{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes}{tgm}Hm{tgm}...|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}{tgm}Felicity, you can come out now.|I know you're around here somewhere.
s;Felicity;You didn't need to do that, Your Highness.
s;Felicity;Enough to know their thoughts on me haven't changed at all.
s;Krista;Do the other maids always talk behind your back like this?
s;Felicity;It doesn't matter if they do or not.|They can think whatever they want about me. I don't care.
s;Krista;You may not care, but I do.|{c:e;Krista;CloseEyes}I'm gonna give them a proper talking to when I get the chance.
s;Felicity;I appreciate it, Your Highness, but it's best if you don't.|It would only get worse if you interfered.
s;Felicity;There is no need to worry about such things, Your Highness.|Someone of your station has higher priorities than the well-being of one of their maids.
s;Felicity;If you'll please excuse me, I have more chores to attend to.
s;Krista;We're friends, Felicity.|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}I can't just stand by like that.

name: SupportKristaKhalid
_source: s;Khalid;Yo, Krista! How goes the archery?
s;Krista;Not bad. Done with lance training for today?
s;Khalid;Yeah. Mind if I kick back and watch you for a bit?
s;Khalid;So{tgm}...{tgm} How've you been holding up?
s;Krista;Hm.{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes} Could be better, could be worse.|{c:e;Krista;NormalBlink}Honestly, I should be asking you that. He was your brother, after all.
s;Khalid;Yeah, but you were gonna marry him.
s;Khalid;{tgm}...{c:e;Khalid;NormalBlink}{tgm} Hey. I know you haven't come around for a whole year, but--
s;Krista;How are you not angry with me?!|{c:e;Krista;HalfCloseEyes}It's been a year, Khalid.|I didn't even try to see you after all this time.
s;Khalid;I was busy mourning too.|{c:e;Khalid;NormalBlink}Honestly, I thought you'd be angry at me for not checking up on you.
s;Krista;A-Anyway, I think I'm done training for today. See ya.
s;Khalid;*sigh*{w}{c:e;Khalid;HalfCloseEyes} Man, Ervan was always better at talking n' stuff.|{c:e;Khalid;NormalBlink}What would he have done?

name: SupportAquaSemi
_source: s;Aqua;I'm doing well. Thank you for asking.
s;Semi;All this time tagging along with the princess hasn't taken a toll on you, has it?
s;Semi;You sure?|You've been running across the battlefield left and right tending to everyone's wounds.|Isn't that tiring you out?
s;Aqua;Semi, I assure you I'm fine!|{c:e;Aqua;HalfCloseEyes}Was us being captured by those bandits still on your mind?

s;Aqua;Oh, Semi{tgm}...|{c:e;Aqua;NormalBlink}{tgm}You don't have to worry so much about me.|I know things have been hectic,|but now we have Her Highness and the Medean royal army by our side!|They can protect us.
s;Semi;Hmph. I trust these guys as far as I can throw 'em.|{c:e;Semi;NormalBlink}Besides, even if I did actually trust them, it still wouldn't matter.
s;Semi;I'll be the one to protect you, Aqua. Always.|That's how it's always been.
s;Semi;It might as well have been.
s;Semi;I'm gonna do what Azure didn't do for years, Aqua.|I don't care what his reasons were for leaving.|He still left, and that's all that matters.|I'll be there for you.

name: SupportAquaAzure
_source: s;Aqua;Azure, how has traveling with the troupe been so far?
s;Azure;Quite well.|You know, once they knew I had a sister,|they begged me to take you along with us if we stopped near the monastery again.
s;Azure;They would go on and on about meeting you.|{c:e;Azure;CloseEyes,Smile}"Oh, Azure, why are you hiding your sister from us?"|"Is she as cute as you are?"

s;Aqua;Haha! I see.{c:e;Aqua;NoSmile} I wouldn't even know what I would do if I came with you, though.|{c:e;Aqua;CloseEyes}I don't play an instrument, my singing voice isn't all that great,|and I don't know the first thing about dancing.
s;Azure;I didn't either before I joined them.
s;Aqua;But you've always been so graceful with your movements.|Becoming a dancer just seemed so natural for you.
s;Azure;Really now? Since we're twins, I'd imagine some of that grace is in you too.
s;Azure;Sure I do. In fact, we can prove that easily.|I'll teach you one of the first dances I learned while in the troupe.|If you can grasp that, then that'll be proof enough.
s;Aqua;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} If anything, it sounds like it would be fun.|{c:e;Aqua;NormalBlink,Smile}Alright, Azure, let's do it!
#Note: Give Aqua a Refresh skill by the end of the chain.

name: SupportMarinaRembrandt
_source: s;Marina;Why, hello, Mister Rembrandt. How are you on this beautiful day?
s;Rembrandt;Just fine, Miss Marina. Can I help you with something?
s;Marina;How is your leg injury? Any signs of it improving?
s;Rembrandt;I'm afraid not. Some days, it's manageable. Others, not so much.|{c:e;Rembrandt;CloseEyes}Overall, I don't see it getting better any time soon.

s;Marina;Have you heard of rehabilitation therapy?|If a circus tumbler takes a nasty fall or if a dancer sprains her ankle while performing,|measures would be taken to ease them back into moving without pain or discomfort.
s;Rembrandt;I'm familiar with the concept, yes.
s;Marina;Did you undergo such treatment yourself, then?
s;Rembrandt;No. I was and am a mere soldier.|Such therapy is for those of rank. Those worth spending such time on.
s;Marina;Every life is worth spending time on, Mister Rembrandt.|{c:e;Marina;Smile}And think of it this way.|You could better serve in the army without that injury hindering you.

s;Rembrandt;Hm{tgm}...{c:e;Rembrandt;NormalBlink}{tgm} That is an accurate assessment, Miss Marina.|However, it has been a long time since that injury.|{c:e;Rembrandt;CloseEyes}I fear it may be too late now.
s;Marina;Nonsense. I can tell by how you move that it is not unsalvageable.|{c:e;Marina;NoSmile}You have a quickness and agility, but it's like you're moving through mire.|I could help you.
s;Rembrandt;How? Unless I'm mistaken, you are no physician, but a dancer.
s;Marina;Exactly. Dance with me, Mister Rembrandt.
s;Marina;I've talked to many who study the use of the sword.|They all tell me that it's a dance.|Footwork is as vital as the sword swings and strokes.
s;Marina;While I am no practitioner of swordplay, I am a dancer.|No one knows footwork better than a dancer.
s;Marina;So, what do you say, Mister Rembrandt? Will you let me help you?
s;Rembrandt;Yes, Miss Marina. I'll accept your help.
s;Marina;Good, I'm glad.|I'll come up with some simple dances we can do together, then we can meet back here.

name: SupportMarinaXiang
_source: s;Marina;"The baron placed his hand on the maid's scaly shoulder,"|"'Perhaps this matter should be a more private affair.'"|{c:e;Marina;HalfCloseEyes,Smile}Oh, Baron Elliot, you sly dog.
s;Marina;Oh, hello there. Xiang, wasn't it?
s;Xiang;Yes.{w} Hm? What is that book you're reading?

s;Marina;This is one of my favorites:{br}"The Lusty Folian Maid".|It tells of a steamy love affair between the roguish Baron Elliot and his maid, Colette.|The interesting part is that Colette is secretly a Dragon Shifter.
s;Marina;Why, yes. I'm sure you know of those creatures lost to time.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}Beasts that are able to change into a humanoid form.
s;Xiang;Yes, I am aware.|I'm just surprised someone would write about this subject in such an{tgm}...{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}{tgm} unconventional way.
s;Marina;My, my, you sound curious.|Would you like to give it a read yourself?|I could lend you my copy if you'd like.
s;Xiang;That would be great. Thank you.

s;Xiang;"Colette gasped as the baron's fingers brushed against her tail,"|"'My lord! You mustn't touch my tail so casually!'"|"'Especially not out in the open like this.'"{w} Is this implying{tgm}...?|{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm}Ugh, a dragon's tail is NOT that sensitive.|{tgm}{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}...{c:wait;200}{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}{tgm} What? Her wings would take up half the size of the room at least!|{tgm}...{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm} Her fangs would NOT be that sharp in her human form either.|{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}And having JUST her claws out for{tgm}...|{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm}Well, I suppose that might make things more exciting.|{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}But everything else is so wrong.{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}{br}What even is this?
s;Xiang;Here, Marina. You can have your book back.
s;Marina;Oh, thank you, Xiang.|{c:e;Marina;NoSmile}That look on your face tells me you didn't enjoy it too much, though.
s;Xiang;I couldn't even finish it. The way Colette was portrayed was just so wrong.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}It's obvious the author didn't know the first thing about Dragon Shifters.
s;Marina;I'm sure he took some liberties here and there.|It's not as if someone could ask a Shifter what they're actually like.|They've been gone from this world for a long time.
s;Marina;I don't typically read stories that involve Shifters often,|so I wouldn't know what the common ways to depict them are.|{c:e;Marina;Smile}However, you seem rather insightful on the subject.
s;Xiang;That is because I am.|{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}Hm{tgm}...{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}{tgm} Alright, that does it.
s;Xiang;I'm writing my own Dragon Shifter story.|One that will set the record straight!
s;Marina;Well, now, I'm intrigued. How would you go about writing this, Xiang?

s;Xiang;If there's one thing the book did correctly,|it was having the Shifter be in a subservient role to the human.|That was common practice.{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes} Cruel, but common.|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}So, I don't believe the main premise has to be changed.|{c:e;Xiang;HalfCloseEyes}Everything else was just{tgm}...{c:e;Xiang;CloseEyes}{tgm} Oh, where do I even begin?|{c:e;Xiang;NormalBlink}There's so much about Colette's forms--both dragon and human--|that were full of inaccuracies.|At that point, I would rewrite everything from the ground up.

s;Marina;You've certainly caught my interest with this.|Do you have any experience in writing romance at all?|I'm not a writer myself, but I have read a good variety of romances.|I could help you come up with ideas, if you'd like.
s;Xiang;I{tgm}...{tgm} would not be against that.|I'll be the one to take care of the Shifter aspects,|and I'll leave the romantic elements to you.
s;Marina;Excellent.|{c:e;Marina;CloseEyes,Smile}Oh, this is exciting!{c:e;Marina;NormalBlink,Smile} Let's start right away.|With us working together, I'm sure we'll write the next big hit.

name: SupportChellAqua
_source: s;Aqua;Now, let's see, what can I top this with?|{c:e;Aqua;Smile}Oh, pineapple! I've always wanted to try pineapple.|{c:e;Aqua;NoSmile}Something sweet like this should go with something savory{tgm}...|{tgm}Maybe the ham?
s;Chell;Aqua? What might you be doing in the kitchen?
s;Aqua;Oh, hello, Miss Chell! I just wanted to make myself a light snack before bed.
s;Chell;This seems like a lot for a "light" snack.|What do you plan on doing with all of this?
s;Aqua;I wanted to try to recreate a popular dish from southern Foliaga.|You take slices of bread and top it with tomato, cheese, a bit of garlic, and meat.|Typically thinly sliced pork or sausage.
s;Chell;That sounds delicious.|{c:e;Chell;NoSmile}But if that's what you're making, why the pineapple?
s;Aqua;I wanted to experiment with more exotic ingredients.|It's a rare opportunity to have access to ingredients from all over Yondo.
s;Chell;Being in Medeas does have its perks.
s;Aqua;Mm-hm! Oh, while you're here, why don't you try some?
s;Chell;A-Ah, are you sure{tgm}...?{tgm} I mean{tgm}...
s;Chell;I'm all for experimenting in the kitchen, but pineapple with ham?|{c:e;Chell;CloseEyes}And the tomato and the garlic too... I'm not so sure about this.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Chell;I'd love to, really, but{tgm}...{tgm} I'm still quite full from dinner earlier.|{c:e;Chell;NormalBlink}So maybe some other time, Aqua.
s;Aqua;That's okay! More for me, then.

name: SupportForrestJake
_source: s;Forrest;Jake, may I ask you for some advice?
s;Jake;Well, sure thing, Sir Forrest! What's troubling ya?
s;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} well{tgm}...{tgm} This is embarrassing, but{tgm}...|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}{tgm}How do you{tgm}...{tgm}{br}court a woman?
s;Jake;Is that all? No need to be so shy about it!|So, who's the lucky lady?
s;Jake;I mean, if I have an idea who the girl is, I could give ya better advice.
s;Forrest;I would feel more comfortable if you gave me more general advice, then.
s;Jake;If you say so.{c:e;Jake;Smile} Anyway, first thing's first.|You gotta get on this girl's good side.|Listen to her problems, do little things for her, stuff like that.
s;Forrest;I do a lot of that already.

s;Jake;There we go! You're already ahead of the game here.|{c:e;Jake;NoSmile}From there, you drop subtle hints that you like her.|{c:e;Jake;CloseEyes}Key word here: SUBTLE.|{c:e;Jake;HalfCloseEyes}Speaking from personal experience.
s;Forrest;But, it still worked, correct?{br}You and Anna--
s;Jake;There were other girls before Anna.|{c:e;Jake;HalfCloseEyes}So many other girls{tgm}...
s;Jake;But yeah, subtlety is your best friend. Don't forget it!
s;Forrest;I apologize, Jake, but subtlety has not made any noticeable difference.
s;Jake;Huh, really? If that's the case, then might as well just be upfront with her!
s;Forrest;N-No! That is not an option.
s;Jake;Alright, alright. I think I see what the problem is.|{c:e;Jake;NormalBlink,Smile}Sir Forrest, what you need is to work on your confidence!
s;Jake;Yup! Once we get that confidence up, you can get your girl, guaranteed!
s;Forrest;I suppose we can try that.
s;Jake;Great! I'm gonna brainstorm some ideas for confidence boosters.|I'll check back in with ya later.
s;Jake;Sir Forrest, there you are!|I've got a whole bunch of ideas to get your confidence up to snuff.|Are you free?
s;Jake;Alright, first off, you gotta remember the most important thing:|{c:e;Jake;Smile}"With great confidence comes great won-fidence!"
s;Jake;Because you'll always be a winner if you believe in yourself!

s;Jake;Now, as an accomplished warrior yourself,|I'm sure you have a nice, strong stance and posture.|So, just keep it up throughout the day, not just in battle.|{c:e;Jake;Smile}The way you carry yourself can get you into the right mindset.
s;Forrest;Hmm, I suppose that makes sense.
s;Jake;Once you're standing tall with your chest puffed out,|then you gotta speak with conviction!|No hesitation!
s;Jake;Aha! That's the problem!|Sir Forrest, you have to make your intentions known.|If you don't speak up, your girl will never know how you feel.
s;Jake;That's quitter talk!|{c:e;Jake;Smile}Here, I'll pretend to be the girl, then you seduce me.
s;Forrest;Uh.{w}{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes} Ahem.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}You,{w} uh,{w} look good today?
s;Jake;Oh, why, thank you, Sir Forrest~ You're not looking too bad yourself~
s;Forrest;Jake, could you please speak normally for this exercise?|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}This is overwhelmingly embarrassing as is.
s;Jake;Work through it, Sir Forrest!|The embarrassment is a barrier you have to overcome!
s;Forrest;This is going to be a long day.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Forrest;That should do it for inventory.|We would need to restock on a few weapons, but outside of that,|the army should be in good shape.
s;Krista;Looks like it.|{c:e;Krista;Smile}Well, I'm gonna get going, Forrest. Talk to ya later!

s;Forrest;Ah, well{tgm}... {c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}{tgm}*Ahem*|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}If you are free this evening, would you like to have dinner together?|Perhaps at one of the local taverns?|It has been a while since we've been able to spend some leisure time together.
s;Krista;I'm down! Let's meet in the foyer a bit before sundown, then.
s;Jake;Sir Forrest! Hi! You look more chipper than usual.
s;Jake;Sure do!|Lemme guess, you've been putting my advice to work, right?
s;Forrest;Hah, I suppose it's obvious.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink,Smile}But yes, that is exactly it.|I'm going out to dinner with Her Highness this evening.
s;Jake;Wait, whoa, what?! "Her Highness"? You mean Princess Krista?
s;Forrest;Yes, who else would I be referring to?
s;Jake;Sir Forrest, I'm gonna be real frank with ya here.|You never told me the girl you liked was the Medean princess herself!
s;Jake;Yes!! By a country mile!|{c:e;Jake;CloseEyes}Man, if you've been followin' my advice to the letter this entire time,|there's no way--
s;Forrest;I don't know what you're so worked up about.|{c:e;Forrest;Smile}Your advice has helped, Jake. Much better than I expected, if I'm being honest.

s;Jake;I-I mean, yeah! Of course it has!{c:e;Jake;HalfCloseEyes,Smile} Haha{tgm}...|{c:e;Jake;NormalBlink,Smile}{tgm}A-Anyway, I'm real happy that things worked out for ya.|You have fun with the princess, y'hear?
s;Forrest;Thank you, Jake.{c:e;Forrest;NoSmile} Now, if you'll excuse me, I must be off.

s;Jake;He actually got with the princess with my advice, huh?|{c:e;Jake;Smile}I must've been way better at getting with girls than I thought|if all of that worked on actual royalty!|I should write a book!

name: SupportForrestNagisa
_source: s;Nagisa;Well, well, the floozy's guard dog is out on the training yard today?
s;Nagisa;Is there anyone else out here?
s;Forrest;I don't think you realize you're walking a fine line here, Nagisa.
s;Forrest;I've said that disrespect towards Her Highness wouldn't be taken lightly.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}And I am a man of my word.
s;Nagisa;Was that a javelin? An ACTUAL javelin?!
s;Forrest;The only reason I missed is Her Highness wouldn't approve of me disposing an ally.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}Although, calling you an ally is a stretch.
s;Forrest;If you value your life, I suggest you learn to hold your tongue.|Now, if we're done here, I shall resume my training.

name: SupportXiangTaiga
_source: s;Taiga;Yo! Xiang! Mind helping me with something?|It's something only you can do.
s;Xiang;I suppose. For what do you need my assistance?
s;Taiga;There's no time to explain, just follow me!
s;Man1;Oh, Taiga. Here to lose all your gold again?
s;Taiga;Not this time! I got a lucky charm on me.|Right, Xiang?
s;Man2;Not like it's gonna make a difference.|Here, let's deal you in.
s;Taiga;<brown>Aw, dammit. This hand's total garbage.|Xiang, what should I do?</>
s;Taiga;<brown>You can see what the next cards are in the deck, right?|So, what should I keep?</>
s;Xiang;<brown>This is the reason for bringing me here?</>
s;Man1;Hey, what are you two whispering about?!|Get on with it, Taiga.
s;Taiga;Alright, alright! Don't rush me, old man!
s;Man2;Well, Taiga, looks like you're completely broke. Again.
s;Taiga;Come on, Xiang. Let's get out of here.
s;Taiga;Argh, that was a disaster!|You didn't help me at all!
s;Xiang;How am I supposed to help you when I had no idea what was going on?
s;Taiga;Wait, you don't know how to play poker?
s;Taiga;What?!{c:e;Taiga;CloseEyes} Aw, Merin, so THAT was the problem!|{c:e;Taiga;HalfCloseEyes}Guess I probably should have asked first.
s;Xiang;That would have been a wise decision, yes.
s;Taiga;Alright, alright. I'm gonna teach you poker.|{c:e;Taiga;Smile}And next time, we'll show those geezers what we're made of!
s;Taiga;Alright, let's review.|Name off each hand, highest to lowest!
s;Xiang;Royal Flush, Straight Flush,{br}Four of a Kind, Full House,|Flush, Straight, Three of a Kind, Two Pair, Pair, High Card.
s;Taiga;Now the suits, highest to lowest.
s;Taiga;And the highest ranked cards are?
s;Taiga;Aw yeah, we're definitely ready now!|To the gambling hall!
s;Man1;So, Taiga's back with her "lucky charm," huh?
s;Taiga;She's super lucky now! We're gonna win big today!
s;Xiang;<brown>Discarding two of your cards has a high chance of winning this round.</>
s;Taiga;<brown>Okay, but which ones should I lose?</>
s;Taiga;<brown>What do ya mean you don't know?!</>
s;Man1;Ha! Your lucky charm having trouble there, Taiga?
s;Taiga;Shut your trap! Just give me a sec here, alright?!
s;Man2;So this is what you call "winning big," Taiga?
s;Taiga;You all can screw off.|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}Let's go, Xiang.
s;Taiga;What the hell was that?!|That was even worse than last time!|I thought you could see the future.
s;Xiang;I can see the future, but not its exact outcomes.|I can only see where the paths lead.
s;Taiga;You could have told me that earlier.

s;Taiga;{tgm}...{tgm} Okay.|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink}I know we can actually win next time.|We just gotta figure out what your powers are trying telling us.|{c:e;Taiga;Smile}So, once we figure out a system, we'll win for sure!
s;Taiga;Okay, so, what about this hand?
s;Taiga;If it's three cards, then maybe it's a Full House?|I've already got a pair of threes here. Let's see{tgm}...
s;Taiga;Hey, a Four of a Kind! Even better!|{c:e;Taiga;NoSmile}Okay, Xiang, I think we got it down this time.|We'll really show 'em what we've got now!
s;Man1;Ready to empty your coin pouch?
s;Taiga;Not this time, old man! Third time's the charm.
s;Man2;I'm all for some easy gold. Let's deal you in, Taiga.
s;Taiga;If it's two cards, then it's probably a Straight.|We've got a five, six, and seven here already.|A bit weak, but it's our best option here.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Man2;Alright. Here are your new cards.
s;Taiga;Straight with a High Card of nine. Not bad.;StyleNid=thought_bubble
s;Man2;Okay. Time to show your hands.
s;Man1;Oh, pipe down. You won one hand. So what?
s;Taiga;I'm tellin' ya, my lucky charm's the best.|Right, Xiang?
s;Man2;Alright, alright. Place your antes, you two.
s;Taiga;And that brings me up to 10,000 gold.
s;Taiga;Nope, not in the slightest.|No cards up our sleeves, no mirrors, no nothing.|Just me and my lucky charm.
s;Taiga;Anyway, good game, boys.|Me and Xiang are gonna head home. 'Til next time!
s;Taiga;We did it, Xiang! All our hard work finally paid off.|So, how do you wanna celebrate?
s;Taiga;Don't be so modest!|If it weren't for your powers, we wouldn't be rolling in gold right now.
s;Xiang;That is not completely true.|You were the one who chose what cards to keep per round.|Your knowledge of poker helped too.
s;Taiga;Y'know, you have a point.|Still, I've been asking a lot outta you this entire time.|I think you should take the helm on this one.
s;Xiang;In that case, could we play poker together? No stakes, just for fun.
s;Taiga;Ha! You really liked all that, huh?|{c:e;Taiga;NoSmile}But that's unfair, don't you think?|You're the one who can see the future here.

s;Xiang;As I have said before, I cannot see the exact outcomes.|You have more practical experience with the game,|so you can logically figure out what could be a better hand.|I would say we are evenly matched.
s;Taiga;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Never thought about it that way.
s;Taiga;Alright, that settles it! You're on, Xiang!

name: SupportTaigaTsurugi
_source: s;Tsurugi;Miss Taiga, I think we're lost.
s;Tsurugi;I don't see the path back to camp.
s;Taiga;Aw, we don't need some dumb path!|{c:e;Taiga;NormalBlink,Smile}If I remember right, we were heading north of camp to get supplies.|Then that just means we need to head south.
s;Taiga;A great question. Look up at the sky.|See that really bright star up there?
s;Taiga;I've been using that one as a guide since we headed out 'cause it's always pointing north.|So we just gotta walk the opposite direction and we'll be back at camp in no time!
s;Tsurugi;Okay, I'm trusting you on this.
s;Taiga;Of course it did! I ain't the navigator for the Wyrmfang Pirates for nothing.
s;Tsurugi;That was really useful to know, Miss Taiga.|I would've been wandering that forest for ages if you weren't there.
s;Taiga;Y'know, that gives me an idea. I'll teach you more about the stars!|That way, you can navigate on your own.|You'll never know if I won't be around to help you out.
s;Tsurugi;That's a great idea! I'll take you up on that, Miss Taiga.
s;Taiga;Great! Just lemme know when you've got a free night, alright?

name: SupportForrestTrevor
_source: s;Forrest;So, Trevor, how have you been lately?|Not too stressed from your first time on the battlefield, I hope.
s;Trevor;Why, I have been doing quite well,{br}thank you.|Fighting alongside you, Her Highness, and everyone else has been most exhilarating.
s;Forrest;That's a relief to hear.|Most people can't handle being in the heat of battle.|I know when I was still a squire,|just the thought of hurting someone else made me uneasy.
s;Trevor;Is that so? That is difficult to believe, in my opinion.|{c:e;Trevor;Smile}Why, look at you now!|You have been protecting Her Highness from ruffians left and right|like a true knight should.
s;Forrest;Most of those rescue missions were unnecessary, but yes.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I have gotten used to upholding my duties as Princess Krista's knight.
s;Trevor;Just how do you do it, Forrest?|I am sure this change of heart did not happen overnight.
s;Forrest;No, it didn't. It felt like it did, though.|I had to do a lot of self-reflection|after Princess Krista was first kidnapped by bandits eight years ago.
s;Forrest;Yes. This was back when Sam was still with us.|And unlike the many times after this one,|this kidnapping was not deliberate on Krista's part.
s;Trevor;That must have been a traumatic experience. At least one would assume so.|And if that were the case, why would Her Highness keep letting herself--
s;Forrest;Don't ask questions you're not prepared to hear the answer to, Trevor.

s;Forrest;We were young when it happened. I would have been around your age, in fact.|The princess was not in any danger before that point,|so it never occurred to me that I would have to raise my sword to serve her.|Not until that day.
s;Forrest;Trevor, while I am glad you can hold your own,|do not forget your duties as Princess Krista's retainer.|You have to be there to protect her no matter what.|That is your number one priority.
s;Forrest;Trevor, just what were you doing out there during the last battle?!|If I weren't close by, Her Highness would have--
s;Trevor;Do you think I don't know that?!|By Medea, Forrest, when there's that many enemies surrounding us,|there's only so much I can do.|Some of us aren't as brawny as you are.
s;Forrest;That is no excuse. Remember what I said before?|Protecting Princess Krista is your top priority.
s;Trevor;Are you suggesting my own life is not as important as hers?
s;Trevor;Do you even comprehend your own words right now, Forrest?|It is one thing to serve Her Highness, but to throw one's own life away so carelessly?|That is inconceivable!

s;Forrest;Then, I'm afraid you will have to reconsider your position as her retainer, Trevor.|It's a difficult concept to grasp, I know. But it is necessary.|Princess Krista is Medeas' future queen. Without her, the kingdom will fall.
s;Trevor;But even so, what if we were gone?|Who would be there to protect her?
s;Forrest;There are other knights and mages, Trevor.|We can be replaced if need be.
s;Trevor;You do not honestly believe that, do you?
s;Forrest;It does not matter what my personal feelings are. This is just the reality of the situation.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}I{tgm}...{tgm} have come to accept that a long time ago.
s;Trevor;{tgm}...{tgm} Are you sure about that?
s;Forrest;Look. We are done here, Trevor.|Just think about what I said.|Do not let Her Highness be in peril again.
s;Trevor;Despite what you may say, I am not the only one who has to think about this, Forrest.
s;Trevor;Forrest, are you well? You seemed distracted during the last battle.
s;Forrest;That is just your imagination, Trevor. I'm perfectly fine.
s;Trevor;I am not so sure about that.|You were so focused on your own actions, you paid no attention to anything else around you.
s;Trevor;Seeing you waver like this is unusual, and quite frankly, it worries me.|{c:e;Trevor;NormalBlink}I wish to help you if something is troubling you, Forrest.|You are my friend, after all.

s;Forrest;{tgm}...|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}{tgm}I was thinking about our discussion from some time ago.|I know I said we could be replaced, but{tgm}...|{tgm}I wish to remain at Her Highness' side for as long as I can.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}The fear of losing her overwhelmed me, I suppose.
s;Trevor;So, there IS a human heart beneath all that armor.

s;Forrest;Oh, please.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink,NoSmile}This may sound selfish of me,|but I do not wish to entrust her life to someone else's hands.|To tell you the truth, when Her Highness brought in Felicity, then Kai, then you{tgm}...|{tgm}I had my doubts about you all. But you proved your worth eventually.
s;Trevor;I am not sure if I should be elated or offended.
s;Forrest;I apologize. I'm not very good at this.
s;Trevor;Do not fret. I know you meant well.|I admire your honesty even if you can be blunt about it at times.
s;Forrest;My honesty, hm{tgm}...?|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}{tgm}May I confess something to you?|I actually haven't said the whole truth.
s;Forrest;I may be upholding my duties as Princess Krista's knight, but ultimately, I{tgm}...|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}{tgm}I love her, Trevor.
s;Forrest;That's why I can't let her go to anyone else.
s;Trevor;I can understand the sentiment, Forrest.|{c:e;Trevor;CloseEyes}I also{tgm}...
s;Trevor;Ah, nothing. Pay me no mind.|{c:e;Trevor;Smile}At any rate, let us continue to do good work together.

name: SupportForrestChell
_source: s;Forrest;Yes, I am. Was there something you needed?
s;Chell;I finished gathering firewood, so I wanted to see if you needed assistance.
s;Forrest;That would be much appreciated. Thank you, Chell.
s;Chell;It is my pleasure.|{c:e;Chell;NoSmile}One moment, isn't that Princess Krista's blouse?|I didn't know you took care of her laundry as well.
s;Forrest;I typically don't. That's Felicity's job.|She's busy catching up on her other duties, so I'm taking over for her.
s;Chell;Is that so?|And you don't feel awkward handling a woman's clothing?

s;Forrest;The way you phrased that made me feel more awkward about it|than me actually doing it.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}But in all seriousness, no.{br}I don't.|I had to take over for Felicity a few times over the years,|and it was embarrassing for a while.|But ultimately, it was something I got used to.
s;Forrest;Is there something on your mind?
s;Chell;Nothing in particular.|It's just with how well you perform your duties around the castle,|I think you'd make a good husband one day.
s;Chell;I apologize. That did not come out as I intended.|I didn't mean to imply that you and I would{tgm}...
s;Forrest;It's alright. I'll take it as a compliment.
s;Chell;Forrest, have you thought about having children one day?
s;Forrest;What's with this sudden question?|Wait, is this related to our discussion the other day?
s;Chell;Yes, it is, actually.|So, has it ever crossed your mind?
s;Forrest;It hasn't.|Well, I mean, it has, but{tgm}...
s;Chell;You'd want Her Highness to be the mother?
s;Forrest;Chell, don't say such things out loud! It's not proper.
s;Forrest;Yes, even if it's--|{tgm}{c:e;Forrest;HalfCloseEyes}...{tgm} How dare you.
s;Chell;Allow me to be frank, but everyone and their mother knows you have feelings for|Princess Krista.
s;Chell;Yes. It has been that obvious for years.|{c:e;Chell;NormalBlink}Pardon me for being overly critical, but it's to the point where it's almost pitiful.
s;Forrest;Your words wound me, Chell.|Though, I suppose this is something I needed to hear.
s;Chell;There is more to life than her, you know.

s;Forrest;That is easy for you to say.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}Protecting Her Highness, staying by her side{tgm}...|{tgm}This life with her is all I've ever known, Chell.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}I cannot stray from it so easily.
s;Chell;But what if you could?|What if one day, you were no longer were duty-bound to her?
s;Forrest;That's{tgm}...{tgm} I can't even begin to imagine such a life.
s;Chell;Maybe you should.|There could be a time when she isn't here.|You never know what could happen in the future.
s;Forrest;A time when she isn't here{tgm}...
s;Chell;Forrest? Do you mind if I ask you something?
s;Chell;Do you think I would make a good mother?
s;Forrest;Still on that train of thought?|What brought this on specifically?
s;Chell;I was thinking about Lin.|{c:e;Chell;CloseEyes}I can't help but think I could have done better.
s;Forrest;Chell, you're her sister. Not her mother.|What more could you have done?
s;Chell;I know, but ever since Mother and Father were gone, I had to be the one there for her.|Was I too tough on her? Did I say something wrong? I--

s;Forrest;Chell, stop. Don't beat yourself up over this.|You tried your best given the circumstances.|{c:e;Forrest;CloseEyes}You were young.|And the pain of losing a mother not only affected her, but you as well.|{c:e;Forrest;NormalBlink}You had it just as hard, if not harder than she did.|No one should blame you for her leaving. Especially not yourself.
